loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем, у нее есть взрослая дочь Валентина. Оксана занимается реализацией женской одежды на местном Каховском рынке. Этот бизнес она начала еще 19 лет назад. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 30 000 гривен. 

Оксане необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того чтобы закупить теплую одежду, а именно свитера, кофты, куртки, на имеющуюся сумму. Так как с середины октября в Украине наступает значительное похолодание, и большинство потенциальных покупателей отправляются на рынки в поисках нужных обновок, Оксана хочет быть готовой предложить им хороший ассортимент товара по приемлемым ценам и тем самым получить дополнительную прибыль в этом сезоне. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oksana is married and has an adult daughter named Valentina. Oksana is in the business of selling women's clothing on the local Kahovka market. She started this business nineteen years ago. At this time her working capital is 30,000 hryvna.

Oksana needs a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvna to buy warm clothing such as sweaters, sweatshirts, jackets using this loan. From the middle of October the weather gets significantly colder in Ukraine and most of the potential customers come to the markets in search of necessary new clothing. Oksana wants to be ready to offer them a good variety of merchandise at affordable prices and by that make an additional profit this season.

loans.use: to buy warm clothing such as sweaters, sweatshirts, jackets using this loan.

loans.name: Awa Diarra

texts.fr: Madame Awa est une femme mariée de 47 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et évolue dans le secteur de la petite restauration. Elle a vendu du  petit déjeuner et déjeuner dans le quartier ou elle habite pendant 3 ans.mais actuellement elle se trouve confrontée a un problème d'emplacement. Ce qui lui a contraint de changer d'orientation. Par conséquent elle s'adonne a la vente de tissus, pagnes tissés, déodorants,etc.  Son objectif en choisissant cette activité est  de subvenir à ses propres besoins sans solliciter l’aide de personne. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2010. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et autres articles divers destinés a développer sa nouvelle activité de commerce pour finalement améliorer le niveau de ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Awa is 47 years old and married. She lives in Senegal and has a small restaurant. She has sold breakfast and lunch in the neighborhood where she lives for 3 years. But now she is facing a problem with her business location, which forced her to change her business. So, she turned to selling fabrics, handwoven pagne cloth, deodorants, etc. Her objective in choosing this activity is to meet her needs without asking for anyone's help. She is a member of one of UIMCEC's branches since July 2010. She has already repaid one previous loan. She is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs intended to buy fabrics and other items in order to grow her new retail business so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for resale

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса разведена. Она уже давно сама воспитывает двоих детей. Лариса с семьей живет в Новой Каховке. Это небольшой город и трудоустроиться всегда было трудно. Поэтому Лариса, чтобы прокормить детей, решила начать свой бизнес и работать в поте лица, чтобы иметь постоянный заработок. Пятнадцать лет назад она начала заниматься продажей самых разных товаров. На сегодняшний день Лариса торгует клеенкой для столов, салфетками, скатертями, москитными сетками и т.п. в магазине «Майдан». На сегодняшний день у Ларисы количество товара на сумму 15 000 гривен. 

Лариса планирует использовать кредит в 12 000 гривен для того чтобы пополнить ассортимент клеенок, скатертей, салфеток и сетки для продажи в своем магазинчике. Лариса планирует быстро реализовать приобретенную продукцию, так как этот тип товара характеризуется высокой оборачиваемостью. На полученную прибыль она планирует и дальше развивать торговлю и содержать свою семью.   

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Larisa is divorced.  She has been raising her two children for a long time.  Larisa and her family live in Novaya Kahovka.  This is small town, and it has always been hard to find a job there.  This is why, in order to provide for her children, Larisa decided to start her own business and work with sweat on her face to have a consistent income.  She started selling various types of merchandise fifteen years ago.  Today, Larisa sells plastic covers for tables, napkins, tablecloths, mosquito nets, etc. in the "Maydan" store.  Today, Larisa's merchandise is valued at 15,000 hryvnia.  Larisa plans to use the loan of 12,000 hryvnia to add to the assortment of plastic table covers, tablecloths, napkins and nets for sale in her store.  She plans to quickly sells the obtained merchandise because this type of merchandise is characterized by high turnover.  She plans to use the resulting profit to continue developing her sales and providing for her family.

loans.use: to add to the assortment of plastic table covers, tablecloths, napkins and nets for sale in her store

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La socia tiene 4 hijos de 19, 13, 8, 8 años de edad, la socia  se dedica aún ala crianza de pollos, la socia compra pollos al por mayor y los lleva  a vender al por menor  a los diversos clientes que tiene en el poblado, la socia esta nuevamente solicitando el credito para invertir en la compra de 200 pollos tiernos para criarlos y una vez que alcanzan la madurez ella los vende, la socia ha creciedo con su negocio de manera favorable al punto que en esta nueva etapa ella esta duplicando el numero de pollos para criarlos y venderlos porque la socia tiene mas clientes que confian en la calidad de sus pollos; el prestamo a la socia le permite seguir creciendo y apoyar con los estudios a sus hijos. La socia reafirma su compromiso de pago y seguir trabajando arduamente.
texts.en: Aurelia has 4 children, aged 19, 13, 8 and 8.  She raises chickens, buying them wholesale and selling them retail to a diverse clientele in the area.  She seeks this loan in order to buy 200 chicks, and plans to raise them for re-sale.  She has grown her business successfully and is now doubling the number of chicks she is raising as her clients are growing in number and have come to trust the quality of her poultry.  This loan will also allow her to support her children's studies.  She is committed to prompt repayment and will continue to work hard to do so.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья – рыночный предприниматель из Новой Каховки. Она торгует женской одеждой, халатами, текстилем, недорогой обувью на рынке в микрорайоне «Сокол». Этим видом товаров Наталья торгует уже 22 года. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 40 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль – около 8 000 гривен в месяц. 

Наталье необходим кредит размером в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить ассортимент одежды, обуви, халатов, полотенец и постельных комплектов для продажи в своей точке. Наталья надеется и дальше развивать свое дело, удовлетворяя потребности покупателей и имея возможность тем самым содержать свою семью. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya is a market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka.  She sells women's clothing, robes, textiles and inexpensive shoes at the market in the "Sokol" micro-district.  Natalya has been involved in this business for 22 years.  At the present time, her revolving capital amounts to 40,000 hryvnia, and her net profit is about 8,000 hryvnia per month.  Natalya needs a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia in order to to add to the assortment of clothing, shoes, robes, towels and bedding sets for sales at her retail outlet.  Natalya hopes to further develop her business by satisfying customer demands and having a opportunity to support her family through this business.

loans.use: to add to the assortment of clothing, shoes, robes, towels and bedding sets for sales at her retail outlet

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: El hijo de la socia tiene 11 años de edad; a la socia le ha ido muy bien en el ciclo anterior tanto así que ahora ella desea invertir el credito nuevamente en la compra de productos como arroz, azucar, leche en caja, harina en bolsas, aceite en bidones, panetones al por mayor en cajas, caramelos, golosinas, para las fiestas de brujas. La socia desea seguir invirtiendo el credito para poder apoyar en los estudios de su menor hijo.
texts.en: Luz Marina's son is 11 years old.  The last loan cycle went very well for her, so now she wants to invest the loan again in buying products like rice, sugar, boxed milk, packaged flour, canned oil, boxes of panettone in bulk, candy, and sweets for Halloween parties.  She wants to keep investing the loan to be able to support the studies of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Jose Victorino

texts.es:
Jose tiene 55 años, esta acompañado, y tiene tres hijos.  Jose aprendió el oficio de la agricultura desde sus doce años, fue su papá quien le enseñó. Jose cultiva yuca en un terreno de 7,000 metros cuadrados.

Jose ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de agroquímicos los cuales aplicará a su cultivo de yuca. Con la ayuda del préstamo Jose podra comprar todos los insumos de una vez, y asi ahorrar tiempo y dinero. De ésta forma Jose podrá aplicar el abono oportunamente, teniendo mejor producción.

En un futuro Jose planea cultivar un terreno más grande. Así el podra tener mayor producción y podra darle a sus hijos una educación profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is 55 and has a common-law partner and three children.  He learned agriculture from his father when he was 12 years old.  He has 7,000 square meters of land where he grows yucca.

Jose has requested a loan through Fundación Campo to buy agrochemicals for his yucca crop.  With the help of the loan Jose will buy all the supplies at the same time, saving him time and money.  This will allow him to apply the fertilizer at the right time, improving production.

In the future Jose wants to expand his plantation and increase production so he can give his children a professional education.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals for his yucca crop.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна живет в Никополе. У нее есть муж, двое взрослых детей и внучка. Татьяна занимается торговлей спортивной обувью в ассортименте, мужской и женской, всякой от летней до зимней. Свое дело она открыла около 15 лет тому назад. В 90-х ее сын работал продавцом на рынке, продавая спортивную одежду. Именно он порекомендовал своим родителям выбрать именно этот товар, когда начинали свой бизнес. Татьяна торговала на рыке вплоть до 2004 года. А в 2004 году перепрофилировала купленный ранее магазин и стали торговать из магазина, а рынок оставила.  

Татьяна планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить обувь оптом на осень и зиму для продажи в своем магазине. Татьяна очень умело умеет подобрать ассортимент товара так, что практически любой покупатель сможет найти то, что ему нужно. Целью для себя она ставит получение стабильной прибыли и помощь детям и их семьям за счет этого. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Tatyana lives in the Nikopol.  She has a husband, two adult daughters and a granddaughter.  Tatyana is involved in sales of athletic shoes and has a selection of women's and men's summer to winter shoes.  She started her own business 15 years ago.  Since 1990s, her son worked as a salesperson at the market, selling athletic clothing.  He was the one who recommended that his parents choose this merchandise when they started their business.  Tatyana sold at the market until 2004, and in 2004, she re-purposed a previously-purchased store and started selling at a store, and left the market.  Tatyana plans to use the Kiva loan of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase shoes wholesale for autumn and winter for sale at her store.  Tatyana is able to choose a selection of merchandise so well that practically any customer would be able to find what they need.  Her goal for herself is to make a consistent profit and use it to help children and their families.

loans.use: to purchase shoes wholesale for autumn and winter for sale at her store

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa, su nuera y su nieto.

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, ocupación que aprendió de su padre. Francisco cultiva maíz en un terreno cerca de su casa. Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, fungicidas y herbicidas. Con la ayuda del préstamo Francisco podrá tener una mejor cosecha, y así obtener mejores ingresos.

En el futuro Francisco planea rentar un terreno para cultivo el cual es de su propriedad, y poder tener otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 59, is married and lives with his wife, daughter-in-law and grandson.

Francisco has been involved in agriculture since he was very young and learned it from his father.  He grows corn on land near his home.  He has requested a loan through Fundación Campo to buy agriculture supplies such as fertilizer, fungicides and herbicides.  With the help of the loan Francisco can obtain a better crop and more income.

In the future he would like to rent out some of his land so he can have another source of income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fungicides and herbicides for his corn crop.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y cuatro hijos (12 años, 11 años, 8 años, 4 años y 1 año y medio), viven en casa propia en un terreno que recibió de una donación de un proyecto habitacional, la vivienda la ha construido poco a poco con los ahorros de la familia y con apoyo de la Fundación Campo.

Él aprendió de sus padres a cultiva maíz, también trabajaron como jornales en la zona, realizando actividades de preparación y mantenimiento de fincas agropecuarias, ayudante de albañilería, desde el 2004 empezó a trabajar como vigilante en una empresa hasta la fecha, en sus horas libres el se dedica a podar jardines, da mantenimiento a céspedes y a parte cuida a una propiedad privada.

El señor Juan esta solicitando un préstamo para construir el techo de su vivienda con madera aserrada  y hierro. Con esto podrá comprar hierro para soporte de las tejas, la madera aserrada ya la tiene. Con la construcción del techo la familia se sentirá con mejor seguridad, se reducirá la humedad dentro de la vivienda, considerando que el piso es de tierra. Esto les brindara comodidad y evitara la humedad y posibles enfermedades de tipo respiratorias.

Él desea a corto plazo construir un muro de retención de suelo en el terreno de su vivienda, en vista que se le esta erosionando y esta volviendo vulnerable su casa. Al tener su casa terminada el piensa dedicarse a la venta de ropa, hamacas, etc. Espera que la Fundación Campo pueda seguir apoyándolos como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 29 years old and lives with his partner and 4 children (12, 11, 4 and 1.5 years of age). They live in their own house on a plot of land that he was given by a housing project donation. He has built the house little by little with his family earnings and with the support of the Fundación Campo.

He learned from his parents how to grow corn as they also worked as farm labourers in the area, preparing and maintaining agricultural farms. He was a builder's mate and then from 2004 he has worked as a company watchman. In his free time he works as a gardener, trimming gardens, maintaining lawns. He also takes part care of a privately owned plot of land.

Señor Juan is asking for a loan in order to build a timber and iron roof to his house. With the loan he will be able to buy iron to support the tiles as he already has the timber. With the construction of the roof the family will feel more secure and the humidity inside the house will be less as they have a dirt floor. This will give them a more comfortable lifestyle and prevent the humidity and its possible respiratory tract illnesses.

He wants to build a short-term retaining wall on the plot of land where his house is located, as the land is eroding and making his house vulnerable. On completing his house, he is thinking of selling clothes, hammocks, etc. He hopes that the Fundación Campo can continue to support them as it has done so far.

loans.use: o build the roof on his house.

loans.name: Bendecidas Por El Señor Group

texts.es: La Sr. rosa es  separada,  tienes 2  hijos en edad escolar,  actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Bendecidas por el señor”  grupo  conformado por  8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio.  Rosa  se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir en el mercado, este trabajo surge a raíz D. su divorcio, ya que ella tenía que mantener a sus dos hijos, ella empezó vendiendo a domicilio con el tiempo se hizo D. un capital, y alquilo un puesto en el mercado, hoy en dia tiene clientes fidelizadosy su negoco esta creciendo, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos van a la escuela y sobre todo cuentan con una mejor calidad D. vida , con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería, polos, blusas, pantalones etc. Sabemos que Sr. Rosa cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo, así mismos con los préstamos que nosotros le brindamos le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is separated and has two school-age children. She is currently a member of the "Bendecidas por el Señor" (Blessed by the Lord) communal bank, a group of eight members who are involved in different business activities.

Rosa sells clothing at the market. This work was a result of her divorce because she now had to support her two children. She began selling from home, and in time she built up capital and rented a stall at the market.

These days she has loyal customers and her business is growing. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has a higher income, her children go to school, and above all they have a better standard of living. In order to keep growing, she has asked for a new loan to buy merchandise: polo shirts, blouses, pants, etc. We know that with a lot of work and effort Rosa will meet her goals, and that loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for merchandise.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La socia sigue con su tienda de abarrotes, ella esta creciendo cada mes gradualmente y le va muy bien, ella con lo que ingresa de la venta de sus productos en la tienda de abarrotes puede apoyar en los estudios y alimentación en el hogar para con sus hijos, la socia ha podido terminar de consturir su vivienda con los ingresos que le genera la venta de sus productos y gracias al prestamo quew solicita ella puede implementar su negocio, en esta oportunidad la socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes y comprar panetones al por mayor, harinas en bolsas grandes, aceites en bidones, leche en cajas, arroz en sacos, azucar y todo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y asi poder continuar con el ingreso de dinero al hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida y el pago de los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Estela continues with her grocery store, which is growing gradually every month and is going very well for her.  The money that comes in from the sale of products in her grocery store can support the studies and nourishment at home of her children.  She has been able to finish building her house with the income from the sale of her products, and thanks to the loan that she is requesting she can stock her business.

With this loan she wants to stock her grocery store and buy panettone in bulk, flours in large packages, canned oil, boxed milk, packaged rice, sugar, and everything necessary to stock her store.  In this way she can continue bringing money into the home and improve her quality of life and the payment of her children's studies.

loans.use: to invest in buying products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es: Hedibia es la presidenta  de la Alcancía Comunal “Señor Nazareno” grupo conformando por 07 personas trabajadoras y entusiastas. Hedibia tiene 51 años de edad es casada y tiene 05 hijos de los cuales 02 de ellos dependientes aun, ya que están en etapa escolar, Hedibia es una mujer trabajadora que con los deseos de progresar  y de aportar con los gastos del hogar inicia su propio negocio la cual vende ambulatoriamente frutas, gaseosas y  confiterías donde la gran mayoría de sus clientes son personas que viajan al centro del país. Gracias a su esfuerzo  Hedibia ha logrado mejorar su vivienda. El anhelo de Hedibia es de instalar una tienda en su casa donde pueda vender sus productos y no tener que trabajar ambulatoriamente. Con el crédito que recibió de EDAPROSPO lo invertirá en su negocio comprando frutas (manzana, melocotón, uvas), gaseosas y confiterías (maní, habas) y de este modo tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Señor Nazareno” están muy agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa Prosperidad. Margarita no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Hedibia is the president of the “Señor Nazareno” Communal Bank, a group made up of seven hardworking and enthusiastic members. Hedibia is 51 years old and married. She has 5 children of whom 2 are still dependent since they are of school age.

Hedibia is a hardworking woman. With a desire to progress and contribute to the household expenses, she began her own business selling fruits, soft drinks, and snacks on an itinerant basis. Most of her customers are people that travel to the center of the country.

Thanks to her hard work, Hedibia has succeeded in improving her house. Her dream is to install a shop in her house where she can sell her products and not have to work itinerantly. She will invest the loan she receives from EDAPROSPO in her business, purchasing fruits (apples, peaches, grapes), soft drinks, and snacks (peanuts and beans), and in this way have what she needs for her customers.

The “Señor Nazareno” Communal Bank is very grateful and promises to continue working with Programa Prosperidad (Prosperity Program). Margarita wasn’t able to be present for the photo because of her work.

loans.use: to purchase fruits soft drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira has operated her food café business for four years; an idea that she had to help bring up her family. She is separated from her husband and has three children under her care. They are ages 16, 10 and 3 and a half. All of them are in school. Subira lives in the Malindi area of Coastal Province, Kenya. She operates her business at the roadside and has a good number of rural folk as her clients. Her main challenges arise during low season when sales volumes get low.

Subira has been a Milango client for three months. She will use this loan to buy flour, sugar and other cereal foodstuffs for her business. She has no other source of income and has set her eyes on venturing into a clothes business in the future. This loan will help her supply her family’s basic needs and educate her children. She is grateful to Milango for providing her with the credit.

loans.use: to buy stock of additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Mariposas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSAS DE ORO” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Julia es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía, venta de maíz, venta de cerveza, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta.

La señora Julia,  indica que hace año y medio que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la ceja y posterior a la elaboración de lo entregará a domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada  y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la reunión, la capacitación en crédito y el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “MARIPOSAS DE ORO” (Golden Butterflies) Communal bank will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer in connection with its Panamerica regional office. The group is composed of eight members and is directed by a board for which señora Julia is the treasurer. The businesses which members of the communal bank carry out include making handicrafts, selling corn, neighborhood shops, and the sale of fruit.

Señora Julia states that for a year and a half she worked with Pro Mujer helping to promote the institution in the area. Currently she has a business selling handicrafts that has operated for three years.

The loan she is applying for will be used to purchase wool taken from the brow and rear of sheep which will be made into products and delivered to customers’ homes. This work allows her to generate income for supporting her family since she is married and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she said she likes the meetings, the training, and the counseling.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia lives in Mombasa town, Kenya. She is married and has one child aged 3 years.  Her child has joined kindergarten. 

Patricia owns a clothes shop that has been in operation for the past 2 years. She began the business in order to provide income for the family. A loan of Ksh 50,000 will help her buy a new stock of clothes.  Her business is located in the heart of Mombasa town and with the high number of customers, she will be able to make high sales. This will in turn improve her family income.

Patricia plans to open other branches of clothes shops in the  future.  Although she faces the challenge of seasonality in her business, she believes that she can achieve much through Milango loans and is happy to be a Milango client.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: José

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Joel le está haciendo falta la bardal alrededor de ella. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar de material que es (block, cemento, arena y varilla ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejorar en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Desea brindarles a su familia la seguridad, protección  y que el patrimonio de sus dos hijos este en buenas condiciones. 
Con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como cobrador de una mueblería ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. Su esposa la señora Celeste Abigail se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joel's home needs a perimeter wall round it.  He is requesting this loan to buy materials (blocks, cement, sand and rods).  He will carry out this work outside of his normal work hours.

Joel would like to provide his family with security and protection, and keep his two children's inheritance in good condition.  Joel will repay his loan with part of the salary that he receives from his job as an upholsterer in a furniture factory.  This is the source of income that he has for his family.  His wife, Celeste Abigail, cares for and looks after their children.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall round his home

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil comes from the village of Gulekari in Abasha District, West Georgia. He is 32 years old, married, and lives with his family ‒ his wife Nanuli, two daughters (10 and 4 years old), a 9-year-old son, and his parents.  His older children go to school.  

All adult family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the main source of the income for the family.   They have 12 milk cows and sell on average 210 kg of cheese per month at the local market.  The family also grows maize on 3 hectares of land. Part of the harvested maize is used for feeding domestic cows and the rest is sold locally.  Along with the above-mentioned, Avtandil owns a tractor, which is an important source of income for them. He uses it for tilling his own land, as well as the neighbor’s plots to earn additional income.  The total average monthly income for the family is 1200 Laris, including pensions from Avtandil’s parents. 

Avtandil has requested a loan to change 2 wheels on his tractor. As soon as Avtandil changes the wheels, he will take harvested maize to the store and start performing the neighbor’s orders for tilling. In the near future, Avtandil plans to make some savings, as he plans to purchase furniture for his family in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: change 2 tractor tires

loans.name: Mario Santiago

texts.es: Mario Santiago tiene 31 años, vive con su esposa, padre de un hijo. Se dedica a la crianza y destace de cerdo, desde hace más de 10 años. El es un hombre trabajador pues ha demostrado que le interesa el sacara a su familia adelante.   Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá invertir en la compra de cerdos las ganas de mejorar cada día han hecho que Mario se preocupe mas por aprender de su negocio.  Su sueño es expandir su negocio.
texts.en: Mario Santiago is 31 years old.  He lives with his wife and has one child.  His business is raising and slaughtering pigs and he has been in this business for more than ten years.  He is a hard-working man who has shown that he is interested in getting his family ahead in life.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to invest in buying some pigs.  His desire to keep improving has meant that Mario has taken more and more care to learn about his business.  His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from Chokhataur in the Guria region of West Georgia.  She is 42 years old, married, and lives with her family –  her husband Shota, their 21-year-old son, and 19-year-old daughter (a student). 

Irma’s husband is leading the agricultural business for the family. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and sell on average 30 kg of cheese per month. They also have a pig and sell on average 9 piglets per year.  Irma is busy with a trading business. She brings clothes from Tbilisi (the capital of the country) and sells them in the village. She brings clothes twice a month with a total value of 500-800 Laris. The total average monthly profit for the family is 560 Laris (approximately 340 USD). 

Irma requested credit to purchase seasonal clothes for resale.   She plans to use the generated profit to change the roof of their house, as it is already old and can’t keep out the rain and snow.

loans.use: buy seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora María Luisa es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comerciante de fiestas, comerciante de miel, artesanía en chamarras, tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras.

La señora María Luisa,  indica que hace medio año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias y posterior lo venderá en su local. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es separada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “HORMIGUITAS” ("The Ants") communal bank is starting their sixth lending cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana focal center.  This group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of whom Señora María Luisa is the president.  The members of the communal bank are progressing various businesses, including: a party business, selling honey, making hand-crafted jackets, weaving blankets, sewing jackets.

Señora María Luisa states that she has been working with Pro Mujer for the last six months, and that she joined the institution at the invitation of one of the members.  She currently has a neighborhood general store where she has been working for the last several years.

The loan that she is looking for is to increase her capital (by purchasing rice, sugar, noodles, etc.)  which she sill purchase at the markets and later sell from her own premises.  This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she is separated with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the training on health and credit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa Idalia tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada, y es madre D. cuatro hijos (todos menores D. edad).

Rosa Idalia se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras desD. hace dos años. Ella vio la oportunidad D. empezar su propio negocio al ver que en su comunidad se producia mucha fruta. Rosa Idalia empieza su jornada todos los días a las 4 am. Ella compra las frutas y verduras D. agricultores en su comunidad, los cuales ella revenD. en un mercado público. Ella venD. frutas como el zapote, limón, mango, y aguacate, entre otros.

Rosa Idalia ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra D. un mayor número D. frutas y verduras para la venta. Actualmente hay productos que sus clientes piden, y ella no los tiene. Ella tambien utilizará el préstamo para comprar directamente D. agricultores o mayoristas, y así eliminar los intermediarios y tener mejores ganancias.

En un futuro Rosa Idalia piensa en tener un vehículo en donD. ella pueda salir a vender sus productos D. comunidad en comunidad, y a otros municipios aledaños.
texts.en:
Rosa Idalia is 45 years old, married and the mother of 4 children (all minors).

Rosa Idalia has sold fruit and vegetables for the last two years. She saw the opportunity of starting her own business on seeing that a lot of fruit was grown in her area. Rosa Idalia starts her working day every day at 4 am. She buys the fruit and vegetables from the farmers in the area and  later sells them at the public market. She sells fruit such as sapota, lemon, mango, and avocado, among others.

Rosa Idalia has asked Fundación Campo for a loan to purchase a larger selection of fruit and vegetables to sell. Currently there are products that her customers ask for that she doesn't stock. She will also use the loan to buy directly from the farmers or wholesalers, eliminating the middlemen and having better earnings.

In the future Rosa Idalia is thinking of getting a vehicle where she can go out and sell her products from community to community and in other neighbouring municipalities.

loans.use: to buy a larger selection of fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is from the village of Didi Jikhaishi in West Georgia. He is 39 years old, unmarried, and lives with his family –  his parents, 2 orphan nieces (17 and 14 years old) and a 7-year-old nephew.    His elder niece is a student and the younger children also go to school.  All three of them receive orphans’ pensions from the Georgian Government. Koba’s parents are retired and also receive pensions. 

Koba is leading the agricultural business for his family. He works hard on the family farm. They have 3 milk cows and 2 calves. Koba sells on average 60 kg of cheese per month at the local market.  They also have a pig and sell 8-9 piglets per year. Along with the abovementioned, the family members grow maize on 1.25 hectare of family-owned land.  The harvested crop is used for feeding domestic animals.  The total average monthly income for the family (including the pensions from Koba’s parents and the orphan children) is 675 Laris (approximately 400 USD). 

Koba requested credit to purchase a milk cow. He will produce and sell approximately 35% more cheese and increase the income for his family. He will use the increased income to improve the living conditions of his orphan nieces and nephew.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.ru:
Николай находится в браке с Ириной. У них двое детей. Николай имеет свой бизнес.
Николай занимается фермерством.  У него шесть больших теплиц для выращивания овощей на продажу. Также Николай строит котельную для отопления своих теплиц. Он трудолюбивый и горит желанием развивать бизнес, так как даное направление является перспективным делом  в этой местности.

Николай просит предоставить кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на устройство отопления для теплиц. Благодаря этому кредиту он сможет продолжить свой бизнес и весной получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Nikolai is married to Irina, and they have two children.  Nikolai has his own business and is involved in farming.  He has six large greenhouses for growing vegetables for sale.  Nikolai is also building a boiler room to provide heating for his greenhouses.  He is a hardworking person and has a burning desire to develop his business because the current business focus is a promising activity in this locale.  Nikolai is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to provide heating for the greenhouses.  Thanks to this loan, he would be able to continue his business and make a good profit in the spring.

loans.use: to provide heating for greenhouse

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia lives in the village of Tsikhesulori.   She is 42 years old and is married. Her family members are her husband Shukri and her parents-in-law. 

Lia and her husband trade in green grocery products. They have a truck which is used for the business. Lia and Shukri purchase products from wholesalers in the nearby districts and sell them in the village.  Along with this trade, they run a family agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and sell on average 40 kg cheese per month in the village. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 2 greenhouses with a total area of 950 sq meters, where tomatoes and greens are grown.  The total average income for the family is 1100 Laris (approximately 650 USD) per month, including the pensions of Lia’s parents-in-law. 

Lia requested credit to purchase green grocery products from wholesalers. She will resale them in the village and earn profit. Lia plans to reinvest the earned profit into the family's farming business.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Pedro Marcos

texts.es:
Pedro es socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 6 años.
Pedro tiene un Taller de Mecánica y es Docente de Mecánica en un Instituto, siempre tuvo el negocio de la Mecánica, recuerda que antes tenia pocas maquinarias y ahora con la ayuda de Finca pudo obtener mas maquinarias, agradece por las capacitaciones recibidas y la ayuda que ha recibido con los préstamos, las capacitaciones ayudaron a aperturar correctamente su negocio y la mejora del mismo, los ahorros son de mucha importancia para él porque le ayudan a poder fijarse metas y poder cumplirlas. Ahora con el préstamo techara su Taller, y la gran meta que tiene  es poder adquirir una Torno Mecánico.
texts.en:
Pedro is a member of the Solidaridad communal bank. He is 53 years old and has 3 children. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for 6 years. 
Pedro has a mechanics workshop and is a mechanics instructor in an institute. He has always had the mechanics business. He recalls that he had little equipment and now with Finca's help he was able to buy more equipment. He is grateful for the trainings he has received and the help he has received through the loans. The trainings helped him open his workshop correctly and improve it. The savings are very important to him because they have helped him to set goals and meet them. Now, with the loan, he will put a roof on his workshop and his biggest goal is to acquire a mechanical drill.

loans.use: to put a roof on his workshop.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Manuel es uno de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres luchando por el progreso 3 & 4, localizado en la ciudad de Santiago, la segunda más grande del país en población y actividades económicas, gracias a esto sus habitantes tienen muchos acceso al mercado al por mayor, también por la cercanía al mercado fronterizo con Haití, donde muchos de nuestros clientes y miembros de este grupo compran sus productos.

Manuel ofrece ventas miscelaneas de diferentes productos, como papeles de baños, zapatos y zapatillas, etc. Es padre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos viven con El y su esposa. Manuel nos dijo que uno de sus retos mas difíciles es poder tener un negocio exitoso, para así de esa manera poder proveer y suplir las necesidades que enfrentan.  En sus tiempo libre le encanta leer la Biblia.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Manuel, el cual invertirá para ampliar su inventario, El compra los papeles de baño al por mayor y los vende al detalle, también compra sus calzados en la frontera con Haití, a muy buen precio y de buena calidad. 

Unos de sus sueños es poder construir otra vivienda y poder alquilarla, así puede generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is one of the members of the women's group Fighting for Progress 3 &4, located in the city of Santiago. It is the second largest in the country in population and economic activity. Thanks to this, its residents have a lot of access to wholesale markets. This is also due to its proximity to the border markets with Haiti, where a lot of our clients and members of the group buy their products. 

Manuel sells different products such as toilet paper, shoes and slippers, etc. He is a father of 3 children, 2 of whom live with him and his wife. Manuel told us that one of his biggest challenges is being able to have a successful business and in this way provide and meet the needs he faces. In his free time, he likes to read the bible. 

This is Manuel's second loan. He will invest it in increasing his inventory. He buys the bathroom products wholesale and sells them retail. He also buys his shoes at the Haitian border at a good price and quality. 

One of his dreams is to be able to build another house and rent it out, in order to make more income.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, and shoes, among other products.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, administra un taller de mecánica automotriz, vive con la esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad. William aprendió el oficio de mecánico como empleado de un taller, hace 8 años, actualmente atiende a los clientes de 8:00am a 7:00pm, realiza reparaciones en vehículos.
Actualmente necesita comprar un Jack, dos micas hidráulicas y otras herramientas manuales, con esta compra estarán en mejor condición para reparar los trabajos que los clientes le lleven, dando un buen servicio.
Su aspiración es tener casa propia, ya que actualmente no posee, espera que después de mucho trabajo tenga la facilidad económica para poderla comprar o construir.
texts.en:
William manages an auto repair workshop. He lives with his wife and 2 children who are 3 and 4 years old. William trained as a car mechanic at a workshop for 8 years. Currently he attends to customers from 6:00am until 7:00pm. He repairs cars. He currently needs to buy a jack, 2 hydraulic lift bottle jacks and other hand tools. With this purchase, they will be better able to repair the work the customers bring them, offering them a good service.

His ambition is to have his own house as he currently doesn't own one. He hopes that after much hard work he will have the economic ability to buy one or build one.

loans.use: to buy a jack, 2 hydraulic lift bottle jacks and other hand tools.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, tiene 50 años, tiene 2 hijos, sacara un préstamo de 2.000, esta en Finca hace 7 años,
Lorenzo tiene un Carpintería Metálica, recuerda que empezó con un préstamo de $50 dólares, y así poco a poco, pudo hacer crecer su negocio, en las capacitaciones que ha recibido a aprendido a administrar mejor su negocio, y ha podido comprar sus maquinarias, ahora esta muy bien pero desea poder mejorar su  Carpintería, y tener mas capital para poder hacer crecer su negocio, y mas adelante tener una sucursal, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de materiales para soldar.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a member of Solidaridad Communal Bank.  He is 50 years old and has two children.  He will take out a loan of 2,000 PEN.  He has been in FINCA for seven years.

Lorenzo has a metal shop.  He remembers that he began with a loan of 25 USD, and then little by little he was able to make his business grow.  In the training he has received he has learned to better manage his business.  He also has been able to buy his machinery.  He is doing very well now but he wants to be able to improve his metalwork and have more capital to be able to make his business grow, and later have a branch.

He will use the current loan to buy soldering materials.

loans.use: to buy soldering materials.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila lives in Sagarejo in the Kakheti District. She is 49 years old.  Leila lives with her husband Michael. She works at a local high school in the position of a cleaner. Along with her main job, she also helps her husband in the family's agricultural business.  Leila and Michael grow mushrooms in their greenhouse. They sell the harvested mushrooms in the village. The total average income for the family is 600 Laris (USD 360) per month. 

Leila will purchase seeds for the mushrooms with the borrowed amount and sow them. In a month, Leila will sell the harvested products and earn profit. She plans to reinvest the earned profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy mushroom seeds

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, tiene 24 años, no tiene hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 4 años. 
Nélida vende ropas en las ferias, ella desde muy pequeña trabajaba, recuerda que se inició vendiendo medias, y poco a poco pudo tener un pequeño capital para poder iniciar con la venta de ropas, Finca le ayuda mucho a poder valorarse y a poder administrar mejor su dinero, y todo lo que puede aprender lo practica en su negocio, ahora lo que mas anhela es poder tener una tienda de ropas, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando comprará mas ropas para poder llevar a la feria.
texts.en:
Nélida is a member of Solidaridad Communal Bank.  She is 24 years old and has no children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years.

Nélida sells clothing in the markets.  She began working when she was very young.  She remembers that she began selling stockings, and little by little she managed to have a little capital to be able to begin selling clothes.  FINCA helped her a lot to be able to assess herself and manage her money better, and in her business she practices everything that she is able to learn.

What she wants most now is to be able to have a clothing store.  With the loan that she is taking out now she will buy more clothes to take to the market.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to take to the market to sell.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана - открытый и очень общительный человек. Она просит предоставтиь ей кредит на закупку спортивной одежды
На полученные деньги Светлана планирует приобрести спортивные брюки, кофты, костюмы. Прибыль с прошлого кредита Светлана потратила на содержание семьи и закупку нового товара.
texts.en: Svetlana is an open and very communicative person.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of athletic clothing.  Svetlana plans to use the obtained funds to buy athletic pants, tops and suits.  Svetlana used the profit from the last loan to provide for her family and buy new merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase athletic pants, tops and suits

loans.name: Ignasia

texts.es:
Ignacia, vive junto con su esposo y tres hijas, ella administra una tienda de productos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, aceite), inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia hace dos años, todos los días trabaja no tiene un horario establecido de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para crecer más su tienda  y comprar más mercadería como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, de esa forma obtendrá mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Ignacia  es  incrementar  sus ventas y  tener más variedad en los productos del negocio cubriendo sus obligaciones y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Ignacia lives with her husband and 3 daughters. She manages a store that sells staple products (rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil). She started the business on her own initiative 2 years ago. She does not have a fixed schedule but works every day Monday through Sunday.

She will use the loan to grow her store more and buy more merchanndise such as sugar, rice, beans, oil, and in this way she will get a better income.

Ignacia's dream is to increase her sales and have a wider variety of products, meeting her obligations and getting ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil for the business.

loans.name: Rio De Plata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RIO DE PLATA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Licoreria, tienda de dulces, tejido de chompas, artesana y diseño gráfico, venta de menudencias de res, ayudante de minibus.

La señora Virginia,  indica que hace dos ciclos trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne que viene trabajando hace años, ya que es un negocio familiar.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de menudencias) que adquirirá del área rural, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en su punto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Río de Plata” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Virginia.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: liquor store, candy store, sweater knitting, crafts making, graphic design, beef offal and minibus helper.

Virginia indicates that she’s worked in Pro Mujer for two cycles and that she joined the institution invited by her girlfriends.  She has been selling meat for several years since it’s a family business.

The loan she’s requesting is to increase capital (to purchase beef offal in the rural areas at wholesale and then resell in her sales point).  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and grill to cook the tortillas on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese and chicharron for her pupusa business.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, lo necesita para cancelar una deuda en otra institución, ella continua con su familia, su hija esta creciendo, y por el momento la necesidad es de saldar una deuda y tener solamente un prestamo vigente con la institucion.
El sueño de blanca es salir de trabajar y poner su propio negocio con el cual le regenerara mas ganancias y su familia podrá vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Blanca requests a new loan. She requires it to cancel a debt from another institution. She continues to be with her family. Her daughter is growing. For the moment she needs to pay off this debt and have only one outstanding loan with the institution.

Blanca's dream is to set out to work and to set up her own business in order to generate an income so that her family's life will improve.

loans.use: to cancel a debt at another institution.

loans.name: Japuraya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JAPURAYA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Reina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de material de escritorio, agricultura, albañil, herrero, costura, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de verduras y frutas. 

La señora Reina  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas y de verduras desde años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de verdura y frutas que comprará de La Paz y lo comercializa en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera.
texts.en:
The “Japuraya” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board headed by Reina.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: office supply sales, farming, bricklaying, metal worker, sewing, grocery store, blanket weaving and sale of fruit and vegetables.

Reina indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer; she was invited by the promotion.  She currently has a business selling fruit and vegetables, a business she’s had for several years.  The loan she will now take out is to increase her stock merchandise (to buy vegetables and fruit in La Paz to then sell in her community).  This way of working allows her to generate income to help her family as much as possible since she’s single.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Faroles De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Deyaniris es la coordinadora del Grupo Faroles D. Esperanza y esta ubicado en la ciudad D. Santiago, la segunda más granD. del país en población y actividades económicas, desD. donD. cada uno D. estos 10 miembros se dedican a realizar sus actividades D. negocio, ofertando a sus clientes productos y servicios tales como: ventas D. ropa, salones D. belleza, venta D. calzados, cosméticos, productos D. belleza, tienda D. comestibles, entre otros. 

Deyaniris realiza ventas miscelaneas desD. zapatos, ropas, cosméticos, hasta accesorios y Ropa interior. Lleva con su negocio alrededor D. 6 meses, el cual inicio con el primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza Internacional, siendo este ultimo su segundo préstamo y lo invertirá en la compra D. estos productos para aumentar sus ventas. Lo beneficios obtenido planea re invertirlo en su negocio y ahorrarlo.

Deyaniris es una joven - madre, tiene dos hijos, D. los cuales solo uno D. ellos vive con ella. Su reto mas difícil es terminar sus estuD., y sus pasatiempos favoritos son bailar, realizar deportes y ver televisión. Uno D. los sueños mas anhelado es poder terminar su carrera universitaria y comenzar a trabajar en ella.
texts.en:
Deyaniris is the coordinator of the Faroles D. Esperanza group, located in the city of Santiago, the second largest city in the country in population and economic activities.  All ten members of this group work on their own business activities, offering their customers products and services such as clothing sales, beauty salons, shoe sales, cosmetics, beauty products, grocery stores, and others.

Deyaniris sells various things, from shoes, clothing, and cosmetics to accessories and underwear.  She has had the business for about six months.  She started with the first loan she got from Esperanza Internacional.

The current loan is her second one, and she will invest it in buying these products to increase her sales.  She plans to reinvest the profit she makes in her business and savings.

Deyaniris is a young mother with two children, one of whom lives with her.  Her most difficult challenge is to finish her studies.  Her favorite pastimes are dancing, playing sports, and watching television.  One of the dreams she most yearns for is to be able to finish her college education and begin to work in that field.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Felipe Jesus

texts.es: El señor Felipe De Jesús se dedica a brindar el servicio de taller de bicletas, tiene 5 años de tener este negocio con ciertos ahorros que tenia logro obtener su propio negocio pues siempre se esmera en brindar un excelente servicio, es por eso que día a día disfruta de realizar esta actividad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas, rines, cadenas, asientos, spray, aceites entre otros repuestos. Su sueño es tener un lugar estable donde vender sus productos y ofrecer sus servicios.
texts.en: Felipe de Jesús provides bicycle repair services; he’s had this business for five years. He used certain savings he had to get a business of his own because he always strives to provide excellent service and this is why he enjoys doing the work he does every day.  The reason for the loan is to buy tires, rims, chains, seats, spray and lubricants among other spare parts.  His dream is to have stable place in which to sell his products and offer his services.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, chains, seats, spray and lubricants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase craft materials such as key rings, chains, wire, acrylic paints, and paint brushes.

loans.name: Jose Osmin Galileo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, el administra una ladrillera, lo comenzó  hace diez años, trabaja de lunes a sábado, no tiene un horario establecido.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar ladrillos (leña y tierra) pues los ladrillos de José son artesanales, hechos de tierra y quemados en un horno, este prestamo surge debido que tiene mucha demanda y también para poder mejores ingresos.
El sueño de José es contratar más personal para elaborar ladrillos y será fácil  entregar el producto a tiempo y que su familia viva en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and two children, aged 9 and 12. He manages a brick factory which he started up ten years ago. He works from Monday to Saturday although he doesn't have a fixed schedule.

He needs the loan to purchase materials to make bricks (firewood and earth). Jose's bricks are artisan bricks which are made with earth and fired in an oven. This loan is required for the increased demand and to improve his income.

Jose's dream is to hire more personnel to make bricks. It would be easier to deliver the products on time and it would improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and earth to make bricks.

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Carlos, es un pequeño agricultor de a zona de Ticuantepe, habita junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Carlos desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para poderle dar una mejor mantención al cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una mejor producción. Agradece la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que los interés son bajos y  sobre todo que sin ellos no fuese posible trabajar su cultivo .
texts.en:
Carlos is a small farmer in the Ticuantepe zone.  He lives with his wife and children.  His plan for the future is to improve living conditions. 

Carlos has been a pineapple farmer for several years.  The greatest problem he faces is not having enough economic resources to provide better care for his crops because he lacks fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for a better production.  

He is grateful for the trust and support given by Afodenic through the Kiva funds because interest rates are low and, above all, because if it weren’t for them it would be impossible to farm his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rhina Doris

texts.es:
Rhina,  vive con su esposo y  dos  hijos, ella se dedica a vender ropa: cubrecamas, sabanas, short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas caballeros y niños, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, dos días por semana sale a vender a los hogares de sus clientes, hace varios años se dedica a este oficio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio, y comprar más ropa: pantalones, camisas, blusas y de esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño de Rhina es tener una mejor calidad de vida y que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y que en el futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rhina lives with her husband and two children. She sells clothing: comforters, bed sheets, shorts, skirts, pants, and blouses for ladies, gentlemen and children. She has her business in her house and two days out of the weeks she sets out to sell in her customer's houses. She has had her business for several years.

She requires the loan to purchase more merchandise to add inventory to her business through the purchase of more clothing: pants, shirts, and blouses. This will increase her profits because she will have a wider variety of items to offer her clients.

Rhina's dream is to have a better quality of life and to keep her children in school so that they will have a career in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as pants, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Marlon Mauricio

texts.es: El joven Marlon , es humilde agricultor de la zona de la Concepción , Masaya .Habita junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es  mejorar las condiciones de vida ; ya que su gran sueño es poder construir su casita de bloques para brindarle un mejor bienestar  a su familia , Marlon desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar Pitahaya , ahora es su trabajo y su fuente de ingresos , pero no cuenta con el recurso económico para poder darle el mantenimiento que requiere la plantación , ya que estas carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para que puedan ser un éxito la producción . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez  de los fondo Kiva ya que a pesar de ser de muy bajos recursos depositan su confianza para poder cultivar mejor la producción de pitahaya.
texts.en:
Young Marlon is a humble farmer in the Concepción zone, Masaya.  He lives with his wife and children.  His plan for the future is to improve living conditions since his great dream is to be able to build a little house out of concrete blocks to provide better wellbeing for his family.

Since a very young age, Marlon’s parents taught him how to farm dragon fruit. Now, that’s his work and source of income.  However, he does not have the necessary economic resource to be able to provide the care his crops need since he lacks fertilizer and other needed farm supplies for a successful harvest.  

He is grateful for the trust Afodenic has placed in him through Kiva funds because despite his being very low income they still trust him to be able to produce a better crop of dragon fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter, esta solicitando un préstamo, lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa: vestidos, pantalones, camisas, blusas y de esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El prestamo anterior le ayudo para mantener el negocio surtido, y gracias a las buenas ventas, cancelo totalmente el prestamo y esta decidiendose por un nuevo prestamo.
El sueño de Walter   es tener una mejor calidad de vida y vender mas ya que su familia dependen de él y darles lo necesario.
texts.en:
Walter requests a loan to purchase more merchandise to add inventory to his business. He plans on buying more clothing, such as: dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses. This will increase his profits because he will have a wider variety of items to offer his clients.

The previous loan helped him maintain an inventory for his business and through the good sales volume he was able to cancel the loan completely. He has decided on taking out a new loan.

Walter's dream is to have a better quality of life and to increase his sales. His family depends on him to provide them with what they need.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, paints, shirts, and blouses for his business.

loans.name: 2K Suma Ampara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2K SUMA AMPARA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Justa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cría y venta de conejos, confeción de mantas, bordados de caporal, confección de chamarras y macramé, venta de productos, taller de textiles, tienda de barrio.

La señora Justa,  indica que es primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza y venta de conejos, la que viene trabajando hace años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de conejos y construcción de corrales) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y posteriormente los criará en su casa. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The 2K Suma Ampara Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Cascada. The group is comprised of eight members led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Justa. The members of the association run a variety of businesses such as raising and selling rabbits, making ponchos, embroidery, making jackets, macrame, textile workshop, and running a corner store.

This is the first time that Sra. Justa has worked with Pro Mujer and she was invited to join by the promotor. She has a business raising and selling rabbits, something she’s been doing for many years.

The loan that Justa is seeking will be used to buy rabbits and to make pens for them. She plans to buy them at the 16 de Julio Market and raise them in her house. The income will allow her to support her family; she is married and has five children.

Justa really likes the information about savings and health that she gets from Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and to make pens

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is 36 years of age. She is a single woman with one child. Ruta owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business. 

Ruta needs a loan of  WST 1000 to purchase additional products to sell, such as snacks, freezes, candies and daily use products.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Ruta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Ruta's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, bananas, onions, and chilies for her business

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va is 30 years of age and is married with no children. Va owns & operates a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  She has many years of experience in this business.  

Va needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Va joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Va's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, el habita junto a su esposa, su hijos ya todos son independiente, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder mejorar la vivienda, don Francisco desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para poder comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para su inducción ya que sin ellos la producción no sale en tiempo y forma hasta podría ser una pérdida total si las plagas llegaran a invadir el cultivo . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Francisco is a small farmer in the Ticuantepe zone. He lives with his wife; his children are all independent.  His plan for the future is to improve living conditions and to make some home improvements.  

Francisco has been a pineapple farmer for several years.  The main problem he faces is not having the necessary economic resources to buy fertilizer and needed farm supplies for their “inducción” [a method to attain uniform maturity and also to control the time of harvest] because without them fruit is not produced in a timely fashion and can even be a total loss if pests manage to invade the plants.  

He is grateful for the trust Afodenic places in him through the Kiva fund.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Martha Aminta

texts.es:
Martha, es casada, vive con  dos hijos D. 7 y 12 años, ella se dedica a vender ropa: short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas caballeros y niños D. forma ambulante  y productos lácteos (queso, quesillo, crema), todos los días venD. en el mercado, desD. hace siete años.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa: camisas, blusas, ropa interior y D. esa forma incrementara sus ganancias y productos lácteos (queso, quesillo, crema) porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño D. Martha es tener una mejor calidad D. vida y que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y que en el futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is married and she lives with her two children, aged 7 and 12. She sells clothing, including: shorts, skirts, pants, and blouses for ladies, men, and children, and she also sells dairy products (cheese, curds, cream). She has been selling every day itinerantly in the market for the past seven years.

She requires the loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her business and to purchase more clothing, including: shirts, blouses, undergarments. She will also purchase more dairy products (cheese, cheese curds, cream). This will improve her profits because she will have a greater variety of products to offer her clients. 

Martha's dream is to have a better quality of life and to keep her children in school so that they will have a career in the future.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Reina Marisel

texts.es:
Reina, utilizara el nuevo crédito para comprar más mercadería enchape, pan, ropa para damas y caballeros ya que debido a que ahora tiene más clientes quiere seguir incrementando sus ganancias.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio, ahora con un nuevo lograra aumentar en sus ganancias y a poder  sacar a sus hijos adelante y seguir trabajando con la institución y siempre tener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Reina will use her new loan to buy more merchandise (gold-plated jewelry, bread, and men's and women's clothes) as she now has more customers and would like to continue increasing her profits.

Reina's previous loan helped her to strengthen her business.  Now, with this new loan, she will be able to increase her profits, support her children, continue working with the institution and always have a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy gold-plated jewelry, bread and clothes

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es: El señor Daniel, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, el habita junto a su esposa e hijos ya todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus nietos en sus estudios para que sean personas de bien y a la vez mejorar la vivienda ya que en tiempo de invierno se le pasa el agua, don Daniel desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recueros económicos necesarios para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para mantener el cultivo ; ya que este presenta una coloración no muy adecuada y la fruta para su edad está mal desarrollada , lo cual para él es de mucha importancia aplicar los insumos necesarios para rescatar la producción .Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que si ellos no fuese posible cultivar frutos sanos , frescos y sobre todo con su sabor natural .
texts.en:
Daniel is a small farmer in the Ticuantepe zone. He lives with his wife and children who are all independent.  His plan for the future is to support his grandchildren’s schooling so that they will become upstanding citizens and also to make some home improvements because during the winter water leaks in.

Daniel has been a pineapple farmer for several years.  The main problem he faces is not having the necessary economic resources to buy fertilizer and needed farm supplies to care for the crops leading to their having poor color and fruit that is underdeveloped for its age.  It is, therefore, very important for him to be able to apply the necessary farm supplies to rescue his production.
  
He is grateful for the trust Afodenic places in him through the Kiva fund because without them it would not be possible to produce healthy, fresh and, above all, natural tasting fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel es soltero, el es un hombre trabajador, luchador con muchas ganas de superación; y por ello que día a día se dedica por entero a su trabajo el cual es la venta e instalación de ventanas y vitrinas (mamparas) que vende a constructoras y locales nuevos de la cuidad y provincias de ICA. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima (vidrios y fierro) para realizar sus trabajos; su principal sueño del Sr. Miguel es comprarse su propia casa y tener su propio taller. El esta muy agradecido por la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en: Miguel is single. He is a hard working fighter who really wants to get ahead. That is why day to day he is totally dedicated to his job, which is selling and installing windows and display cases that he sells to builders and new locales in the cities and provinces of Ica. He is going to invest the loan in buying materials (glass and iron) to do his jobs. Miguel's main dream is to buy his own home and have his own workshop. He is very grateful for the trust put in him.

loans.use: to buy materials (glass and iron)  to do his jobs.

loans.name: Faapito

texts.en:
Faapito is 18 years of age.  She is married and has one child. Faapito owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. 

Faapito needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 240 talas or US $100 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Faapito joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faapito's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Santos Elena

texts.es:
Santos Elena de 39 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Santos Elena desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y gallinas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Santos Elena es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante junto con esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Elena, 39, lives in her own house which lacks basic utilities with her family in the rural part of Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts.

Santos Elena has been raising small farm animals (pigs, sheep and chickens) to sell.  Her corrals are in her back yard and they are appropriate and spacious.  She feeds her animals nutritionally balanced feed, grasses and natural grains so that they will reach optimum growth and be able to sell them in the various local markets obtaining good profits to meet family needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more nutritionally balanced feed and medicines for her animals.  She will use profits from the sale of her animals to repay the loan and to have a better quality of life.  Santos Elena is a person who has known how to get ahead with her husband and children thanks to much effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balance feed and medicine for her animals.

loans.name: María Doraliza

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Alianza Unida, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Llacao (Cuenca), este lugar  tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar y disfrutar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y solidarias, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 65 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
