She is requesting to loan to buy merchandise such as cases of soda, basic grains, coffee, and bread.  She also will buy kitchen utensils, barrels to make "nacatamales" (regional tamales wrapped in banana leaves), ladles, buckets, plastic bags, sweets, and other products.

She is grateful to the finance company for the opportunity to grow in her social and economic habits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City with her husband and three children. 

Julieta has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month.  

She requests a loan of 10,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  Julieta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Zandan

texts.en: Zandan is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a mongolian yurt in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, his elder son is a college student, and his younger son goes to school. He started his business in 2000 by buying tennis and billiard tables. Now, his wife runs the business and he drives his own car as a taxi. Their workspace is large enough for storage, so he decided to rent it as a warehouse. In order to rent it as a warehouse, he needs to install a heating system in the area. When he installs a new heating system, the warehouse has potential income of 500,000-900,000 MNT per month. He is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT, which he will use to maintain his workspace and to install heating.

loans.use: to install heating in a warehouse

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband is a plumber. Her eldest child is an elementary student and the younger two go to kindergarten. She is a certified tailor who started her business in 2008 by renting a work space. She is well known by her skills and services around the neighborhood. In the near future, she wants to expand her business and buy her own work space. She is requesting 400,000 MNT to buy materials to make clothes.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 41 years old and lives in Taboc, Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married and has three children. Arlyn has a sari-sari store (general store) and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her general store. Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
To earn a living, Edwina has a general store. Edwina is 52 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor. She is married with four children. Edwina earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

Edwina has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one year. In the future, Edwina would like to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Siquijor.  She is married and has five children.  Clarisa sells kitchenware products everyday.  Her business is located along the highway of Poblacion. She has had this business for eleven years. 

Clarisa requested a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase more kitchenware products to sell.  She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  In the future, Clarisa hopes to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: buy kitchenware products

loans.name: Nhem's Group

texts.en:
Nhem, 53, lives together with her two single children in Kompong Chhnang province.  She is a farmer and recently owns a small store selling mixed products to the people in and around her village and the travelers who come across her store. She can earn about $1.75 per day through her business. Her oldest child also helps support the family by working as a construction worker in mobile places. 

Nhem has applied for a loan from Kiva's lenders for the purchase of construction materials to support her son's business. She hopes that this loan will increase the income for her family.  

Nhem is the leader of this group loan with four members: Mr. Va, 44; Mrs. Pech, 34; Mrs. Chea, 23. These three people are in the same business of cultivating rice crops. Because of the coming rainy season, these three people have the same purpose in using Kiva’s funds. They will use this loan to buy mineral fertilizers to spread on their farmlands in order to make their plants grow well.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Maria Flordelona

texts.en:
Maria Flordelona is 42 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Maria Flordelona owns a general store to earn a living.   She has had this business for four years.  Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for  PHP 15,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.  

Maria Flordelona has been a member of Paglum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.

loans.use: buy more stocks for her store

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 44 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Estela runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Estela has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for nine months.  In the future, Estela hopes to alleviate their living condition from being poor through the continued support of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 49 years old and lives in Tinago, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Felicitas sells fresh fish in her neighboring barangay everyday. She has managed this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Felicitas has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for nine months.  In the future, Felicitas hopes to have more income from her business so that she can support the financial needs of her children in school.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Judith Maria

texts.en:
Judith Maria is 49 years old and lives in Calunasan, Larena, Siquijor.  She is a single-mother of three children.

To earn a living, Judith Maria has a business making and selling bread.  She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work.  Judith Maria has a requested a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to purchase assorted ingredients for her bread making business. 

Judith Maria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for four months.  In the future, she would like to help her three children finish their studying despite being a single-mother.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa  is 48 years old and living in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.  Luisa is cultivating 7500 square meters of coconut trees for the production of coco sugar known as The Organic Sweet Option.  Coco sugar is known to have health benefits and is good for people suffering from diabetes.  Findings state that coco sugar has more advantages compared to sugar coming from sugarcane even though it's more expensive. 

Luisa has 90 coconut trees and has 3 harvesters who are each collecting 8 gallons of toddy or tuba (coco sap) every day. Luisa can make 360 kilos of organic coco sugar per month, with 200 per kilo as the selling price.  Luisa was the first coco sugar maker who joined trade fairs and was able to show it to the market.  Coco sugar, an organic sugar, has high interest in the local and global market nowadays.

HSPFI is advocating organic farming and the production of organic products in the region.  Luisa is one of the privileged clients of HSPFI and KIVA, who makes available the individual loan.   Luisa is now requesting a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP. She is planning to purchase a new oven for coco sugar processing and additional cooking tools and equipment for a bigger production each month.  The loan will also be used for the development and sanitation of the cooking area or production area.  Luisa is hopeful of having more success in her coco sugar business in the local and global market.

loans.use: improve her coco sugar business

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen is 25 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor.  He is single.

Glen is a fisherman and catches fish everyday to earn a living.  He has been doing this for two years. He has requested a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to purchase a fishing net.

Glen has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for nine months.  He hopes to help his family out from the income in fishing.

loans.use: buy a fishing net

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, age 27, is a humble villager from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is married to Chen and has one lovely child living under her care. This couple is working hard toward their dreams: they want to secure their family from poverty and develop their business more successfully for the future.  

Mrs. Vann is a hog raiser. She has been involved in this business for 4 years, that’s why she has enough skill to fatten up her pigs rapidly and avoid her pigs from illness. From this business, she typically earns about $2 per day to cover her daily expenses. 

This year Vann plans to purchase a plowing machine to use on her farm as well as to hire out to the people around her community in exchange for money. But she doesn’t have sufficient capital to buy one. Therefore, she is seeking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to her existing capital in order to buy a plowing machine. She would like to say thanks to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: buy a plowing machine

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 47 years old and lives in Ponong, Larena, Siquijor. She is a single mother of one child.

Nelda sells of fresh fruits, spices and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables to sell in the market.

Nelda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits, spices and vegetables

loans.name: Marianito

texts.en: Marianito is a 35-year-old fisherman living in Talibon, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 10 years. He is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other fishing gear. This loan will help Marianito keep earning from his business. Marianito works hard to support his family of a wife and two children. In the future, Marianito hopes to expand his business. He also hopes to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other fishing gear

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is 38 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is single. Antonia has a business selling food--local delicacies--and earns approximately 1,200 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her business. Antonia has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 43 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children. She is engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. She has had this kind of business for three years. Avelina is thankful because she is able to provide the needs of her family through her buy-and-sell fruit business. She wants to support her children until they finish their schooling, but her funds are not enough because of the increase of household expenses. With this regard, she is asking for additional capital amounting to P7,000 to buy more bananas to be sold within the village where she lives. She hopes that her sacrifices will be fruitful, enabling her to generate a bigger income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for her fruit vending activity.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 51 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She has a food vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her viand business. Delia has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her viand business.

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en: Neriza is 28 years of age and married with one child. At her young age, she is able to manage her variety store. She has been operating it for three years, and she is able to earn about P3,500 a month. She would like to improve her store by completing the set of groceries she sells. With the income generated from her business, Neriza couldn't buy a complete set of basic needs due to the high cost of basic commodities. For this reason, she is asking for additional capital in the amount of P7,000. She believes that she could improve her store by having a complete set of basic needs. Through her loan, she could satisfy her customers' demands. In this way, she could generate more income to provide the needs of her family and save some for the education of her only child.

loans.use: to buy a complete set of basic needs for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is a 62-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells various items like canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. Antonia also buys and resells sea shells and scrap. Antonia works hard to support her family. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and scrap. Antonia hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and scrap.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 57 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. She has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more clothes for her business. 
Agapita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Chuon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Choun is a 54-years old farmer, married with three children in Kompong Chhnang province, where he has been living and cultivating rice crops for ages. From his business, he can earn an average of $1.25 USD per day. This low profit cannot provide the family a comfortable living. 

Mr. Choun was chosen to be the leader of this loan group of two members. The other group member is Mrs. Sdeung. She is a widow woman who is in a basket making business.

In an attempt to yield increased profits, Mr. Choun and Mrs. Sdeung have joined together to ask for some funds from Kiva. They want to use this loan to buy some cattle for breeding. This loan will help them increase their income and provide their families with a good standard of living. They are very grateful to all Kiva’s lenders who kindly provide their funds to help their families.

loans.use: to buy some cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Moyniso

texts.ru: Мойнисо проживает в районе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 31 год. У нее двое детей. Ее муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Мойнисо у себя дома занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Moyniso lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 31 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is involved in to-hire construction work.  Moyniso is involved in animal husbandry at home.  She breeds livestock for subsequent resale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо проживает в городе Нурек. Возраст, 40 лет. Разведена. Имеет двоих детей. Зебо уже пять лет как занимается торговлей. В городе у нее имеется магазин, где она продает разноцветные нитки, тюбетейки, кошельки, метровые ленты и ткани. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей, детских костюмчиков и платков.
texts.en: Zebo lives in the city of Nurek. She's forty years old, divorced and has two children. She's run a business for the past five years. Zebo owns a store in the city where she sells multicolored thread, skullcaps, wallets, ribbons and cloth. She's asking for a loan in order to buy some fabrics, children's suits and handkerchiefs.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, children's suits and handkerchiefs.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. Hean is a 38-year-old diligent farmer. She was born in Kompot province, which is a good economical zone for agribusiness. She has been engaged in cultivating her business for 16 years. She usually generates a profit of $2 each day to support her family and financial needs. Mrs. Hean realizes that every day there’ll be many tourists and people from other places who come to visit her province and pass her store, so currently she has been operating a selling business along the nearby street. She sells seafood such as crabs, prawns and oysters. In order to sustain her business, Mrs. Hean has requested a loan of $300 to buy additional seafood to sell. With the increased profits, she wishes to buy a boat that can be used by her husband to catch edible animals from the sea.

loans.use: to buy additional seafood to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 45-years-old and lives in Lobogon Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.
 
Luzminda has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more clothes for her clothing business. 

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 30-years-old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. 

Jocelyn has a barbeque vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000  to purchase raw ingredients for her barbeque business. 

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 51-years-old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. She is married with 4 children. She has a nipa (palm fronds) weaving business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 4,000 to purchase materials for her nipa weaving business. 

Grace has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Grace hopes to have a big capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her nipa (palm fronds) weaving business

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn runs a sari-sari store business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells items like coffee, milk and canned goods. Rubelyn also sells fish at the market. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch. 

Rubelyn has requested this loan to buy more fish and items to sell at her store and to pay for her children's tuition fees. Rubelyn hopes for her businesses to improve. She also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish and items to sell at her store and pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married with 4 children. Maricel is 36-years-old and she presently resides at Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. 

Maricel is in an agricultural business. To earn a living she manages a corn farm and after harvest she sells it to the contract buyer. Maricel has been in this business for about five years and she has a monthly income of Php 3,230. 

She requested a loan of Php 5,000 to acquire fertilizer. Maricel is a member of GDMPC this year only. She is in the first cycle. She hopes that with the help of GDMPC her family will live well because of the earnings rendered with her business that is funded by the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Wakape Njete Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wakape Njete Group in Western Kenya! Moses is the facilitator of the Wakape Njete group. Several members of this group are entering their third season with One Acre Fund!

Moses takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund due to the fact that he could access fertilizer and hybrid seeds at an affordable rate, and grow enough to feed his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Moses was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Moses will continue to invest in his farm and pay for household expenses.

In 2012, the members of Wakape Njete group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph, Moses is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is an honest and hardworking person. To make a living, she raises hogs.  She breeds and fattens them and then sells them to butchers who came into their village. She had been doing this for almost six years.  In this kind of business, she usually earns PHP 3,000 for each hog sold. She spends her leisure time cleaning the pigpen to ensure its cleanliness. Her spouse provides motorcycle services to the people in their village. The couple works very hard to acquire income to pay school fees on time.

Leonor is now 58 years old and has been blessed with five children. All are attending school and need daily allowances.

Leonor is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy an additional pig to raise and also feed and medicine. She would like to strengthen her business to earn additional income to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy a pig, feed and medicine

loans.name: Saidmuhidin

texts.ru: Саидмухидин проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Три года как занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа двух бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Saidmuhidin lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 29 years old and married.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years.  He breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  Saidmuhidin is requesting this loan to buy two bulls in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 58 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is divorced and has 2 children. 

Veronica has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month. She has requested a loan  of PHP 14,900  to purchase more clothes for her clothing business. 

Veronica has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been engaged in a retailing business where she sells different kinds of basic commodities and other products needed within their village. She is 52 years of age, married, and has three children. Aside from her store, she also sells fish within their local community.

Lolita aims to buy more groceries such as sugar, cooking oil, beverages and other products needed in her retail store, but her income is just enough for their daily needs. So, Lolita is requesting for additional capital in the amount of PHP 7,000.  In this way, she can make her business more profitable and attractive to many customers. She hopes that she can maintain her retail store and save some money for her emergency purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: buy grocery products

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар житель города Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 28 лет. У него двое детей. Он занимается у себя дома разведением крупнорогатого скота. Диловар создал все условия для разведения скота. Он закупает скот, откармливает и через два месяца продает. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров и телят.
texts.en: Dilovar lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  He is involved in breeding cattle at home, where Dilovar created all of the necessary conditions for breeding livestock.  He buys livestock, fattens it up and sells it after two months.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  Dilovar is requesting this loan for the purchase of two cows and calves.

loans.use: to buy two cows and calves

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en: Adelyn is a married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 13 years old. Adelyn has been in the business of scrap buying and selling for 2 years. She works hard to support her family. She is happy that her business generates income for her family.   Adelyn requested this loan to buy more scraps to sell.  She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: buy scrap materials

loans.name: Narayan Devi

texts.en:
Narayan Devi is 36 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 15 and 14.  In 1998, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  

Narayan Devi has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve living standards extra training is needed.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: buy grocery goods

loans.name: Florevel

texts.en:
Florevel is 31 years old and lives in Cabgan, Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is married and has five children. 

Florevel works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase 5 boxes of fish to sell. 

Florevel has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: buy 5 boxes of fish

loans.name: Antera

texts.en:
Antera is a 55-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 20 years old. Antera started buying and selling scraps 3 years ago. She also sells fish to the people in her community. She does her best to support her family.

Antera has requested a loan to buy more fish and scrap materials to sell.  She hopes to build her own junk shop soon.

loans.use: buy fish and scrap materials

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза жительница города Вахдат. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более семи лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется собственный магазин, где она продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Firuza lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 36 years old, married and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  Firuza has been involved in retail sales for over seven years.  She has her own store, where she sells children's clothing.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 63 years old and lives in Ciriaco, Pastrano, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 6 children.
 
Rosalina has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,200 each month. She has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 33 years old and lives in Napisik, Sulipat, Calamba.  She is married and has one child. 

To earn a living, Corazon has a quarrying business. She has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6500.  She has requested a loan of  PHP 30,000 to purchase housing materials to complete her house. Corazon has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: buy building materials

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is married but doesn't have children yet.  She is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ailyn is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 5 years.  Ailyn has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer for her rice production.  

Ailyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 year.  She hopes to make her business successful in the near future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita is 46 years old and lives in D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Avelita has a handicraft business and earns approximately PHP 4300 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of 14900 to  purchase assorted stocks of handicrafts worth 14900. Avelita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To purchase assorted stocks of handicrafts

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling personal items in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buying and selling of personal collection business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years. Jenelyn earns more income from the sale of vitamins.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is 48 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Calamba. She is married with four children. Ida has a shop that sells grocery items and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 14,999 to purchase ten cases of beverages and five boxes of groceries. Ida has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To purchase ten cases of beverages and five boxes of groceries

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en: Marialyn is 39 years old and lives in Conat Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Marialyn has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Marialyn has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Marialyn hopes to have a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ki

texts.en: Ki, 49, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Ki is a groceries seller, earning an income of around $10 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. Ki is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the profits from her business to repair her house. This will be her first loan from Credit, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Eleuteria has been in the business of making clay pots for 10 years. She earns about 5,000 PHP per month with this business. Eleuteria also raises pigs in her backyard to sell at the market. She plans to use her loan to buy piglets and materials to make clay pots. Eleuteria hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and materials to make clay pots

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is widowed with two children. Lida is 61 years old and lives in D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Lida sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase bananas and vegetables.

Lida has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and vegetables

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a responsible and kind person. She lives with her husband and two children. Betty has been running her hog raising business for four years and she is happy to see her piglets growing. She is glad because her family members are supportive and they have unity, especially in doing their daily household tasks.

Betty would like to request additional capital to buy vitamins and feed for her raised piglets. She can then offer them at a higher price when they reach their optimum growth. She hopes she can get her loan of P7,000. Betty believes that she can make her business more profitable which will enable her to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her piglets

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna, a 44-year-old married mother of eight,  works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for a year, and also earns an income from rice retailing. Having borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF, Lorna is now requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to purchase more goods to sell, and aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 15000 (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

Eva has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with 4 children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general goods) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoos, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and pig fattening.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 36 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Phoebe is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets to raise.

Phoebe has been raising pigs for a year and also earns additional income from buying & selling of livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and married with 7 children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Teresita has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general goods) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 50 years old and has 5 children. Leonila is married and has 3 children who are in school and the other 2 children work to help the family.

Leonila is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and feeds for her pigs.

Leonila has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she could continue the education of her 3 children.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 23 years old and lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married and has no children. 
Arlene has a clothing business where she earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month. She has requested a loan of 11,000 to  purchase more materials for her house. 
Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Arlene hopes to have a large amount of capital from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her house

loans.name: Mavelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Mavelle works hard to support her family. She operates a buying and selling of birds nests business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs. 

Mavelle is borrowing PHP 30,000, through NWTF, to purchase more birds nests to sell for her business.

Mavelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more birds nests to sell.

loans.name: Prok

texts.en:
Prok (in the photo), 37, is a cleaner for a company. He has a young son and lives in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife is also a cleaner with him. 

Prok is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get work.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fish to sell for her fish vending business. Natividad has been in this business for 20 years. Natividad earns more income from her sari-sari store.

Natividad has been sustaining her business activities, through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Samol is a nurse, earning around $11 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. Samol is requesting a loan of $800 to pay for her children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to repair her house. This will be her first loan from Kredit, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 43 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 20 and 17. Janeth's husband works as a farmer.

Janeth provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community. She also sells dried fish. Janeth works hard to help her husband provide for their family's needs. She requested a loan to buy mani-pedi materials and more dried fish to sell. Janeth hopes to have a stable income that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy manicure and pedicure materials and more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 35 years old and married. She has 2 children.

Sonia works hard to provide for her family, running a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 28000 loan, through NWTF, to buy more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store. Sonia has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Sonia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 49, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Emma, a housewife and mother to their six children. Together they manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Romeo operates a tricycle transportation business. He owns a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached into it) that carries up to four to five passengers to their destination within the community. He earns through the boundary (daily quota) that their driver remits each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be using the loan for additional spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Romeo hopes to be able to expand soon and to sustain their daily needs. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 45 years old and has 5 children, one child is in school. She is married.

Vivencia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan, through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Vivencia has been raising pigs for 3 years now. She has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vivencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norol

texts.en:
Norol is 48 years old and widowed. She has 8 children.

Norol earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000, through NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for the next crop. Norol has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from retailing the rice.

Norol is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for the next crop.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 57 years old and married with 7 children.

Pacita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general goods) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoos, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Pacita has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Pacita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (general goods) store

loans.name: Rosalem

texts.en:
Rosalem is married with 2 children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalem is 28 years old. 

Rosalem has a sari-sari (general goods) store in the Philippines. Rosalem requested a PHP 20 000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Rosalem has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosalem would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with four children. Norma is 62 years old and lives in Solinog, Calamba.

Norma sells peanut butter to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase one sack of peanuts and other raw ingredients for making peanut butter.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase peanuts and other raw ingredients to make peanut butter

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Mildred's husband works as a driver.

Mildred has been in the hog-raising business for five years. Each month, Mildred earns 5,000 PHP with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy pig feed and pay for her children's tuition fees. Mildred hopes to help sustain her children's education through her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pay for her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Vanny, 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Vanny is a housewife and her husband is a soldier, earning an income of around $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $33 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. Vanny is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for the children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to repair her house. This will be her first loan Kredit, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for the children's school fees

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom (in the photo) and her husband raise pigs and produce rice wine. They married in 1987 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One is learning a technical skill, one is in high school and another one is still young. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Rom is asking for another loan of $1,000 to buy pig feed. She will also use part of the loan to pay school fees for her son who is learning a technical skill.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Perisa

texts.en:
Perisa is 25 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and beans in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Perisa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase her goods for sale. She will use her profit from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and beans to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a young entrepreneur who is married with one child. Her husband's occupation is farming while she is busy operating her home-based store. She has been managing it for one year and she is able to earn about PHP 1,500 monthly. Edna would like to buy more items for her store to increase her sales and have a greater income but her funds are not enough due to the increase in basic commodities and the credits of her customers. So Edna would like to ask for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. With her loan, she can increase her profit and encourage more customers to buy from her store. She believes that her business will allow her to move her family forward and provide them a better quality of life each day.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 49 years old and lives in Makawa Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. Cristina has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more ingredients for her viand business. 
 
Cristina has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her viand business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
This is Miriam, 49, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Reynaldo, a breeder. She is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Miriam operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Miriam hopes her business will be stable and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo aims to increase his yields so that he can earn a higher income. However, due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay labor costs for planting corn.

Domingo is responsible for managing his corn farming business. He is 57 years old, married and blessed with 10 children. Due to the high cost of commodities, he needs to earn more income to satisfy their daily needs and to lift his family from poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay labor costs for planting corn

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 45-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 20 and 18. She owns an eatery located at the front of her house. She cooks food that she sells to the people in her community. She also sells soft drinks. Carmelita has requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices. Carmelita hopes for her business to grow. She also wants to see her children finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Mitimos, Rizal.
To earn a living, Florenda works in a charcoal business. She has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3500. She has requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase 5 sacks of charcoal. Florenda has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Bunly

texts.en:
Bunly (in the photo) is 38 years old and his wife, Kunthea, is 32 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two are in school and two are still young. The family is living in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife is a garment worker.

Bunly is a driver; he has his own pick-up truck and is hired by villagers to carry things from one place to another. He gets paid a fee. Bunly also raises cows at home. He sells calves when the cows give birth. 

Bunly is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional cows to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional cows to raise.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Running a retail store for a daily profit of P200 is what occupies Maxima's daily schedule. She keeps generating income to provide a good education for her two children. She has six children. Four of them are married and now live independently. 

According to her, she has many competitors in the village who sell the same items as she sells so she needs to buy more grocery items for her store. She is now requesting a loan of P23,000 to buy items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell. 

In the future, she would like to see her two children finish a degree and someday seek good employment and help lift their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
This is Eva, 47, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Eva operates a rug-making business. She offers rugs from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets and other crafts that most rug-makers do. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning they are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeep down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric and thread. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Eva hopes her business grows in the coming years and that she can establish a dress shop. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in the school. She has a clothes selling business in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, with the hope of expanding her business. She will use her profits to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Enoque

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e tem 4 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas de casa. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane aprocura de melhores condicoes de vida, trabalha como electrecista auto na Super Steel ha mais de 2 anos , e tem um salario de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca solicitou emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 30.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (ferro, areia, barrotes, chapas e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, também  para a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, mais tarde construir uma mercearia  para a sua esposa, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Enoque was born in the district of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. He went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother financially, sending her money to help with her expenses.

He left Chibuto for Boane in search of a better life. He's worked as an auto electrician at Super Steel for more than two years and earns a salary of 12,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account (BIM).
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fifth loan, in the amount of 30,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, rebar, sheet metal, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 10,000, 12,000, and 15,000, and 20,000 meticals, were all also used for his home.
He hopes to finish the house to offer his family a more comfortable life. In the future he would like to build a grocery store for his wife, for which he will request further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, rebar, sheet metal, etc.).

loans.name: Elephant Group

texts.en:
Bufu, who is in his mid 40s, is married with four children: two of them are independent and two of them are still going to school. He has been running a fruit and vegetable business for two years now. He works from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy missing items he needed. He took care of his family and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase his stock of fruit and  vegetables. His dream is to one day be able to buy a car for transporting his fruit and vegetables from the market place.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Elephant" who has a total of 26 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. 
Lorna has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has  requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase more ingredients for her business. 
Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lorna hopes to have a food stall.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products (fish, eggs, peanuts, rice, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Ecelina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  provincia  de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe  de 3 filhos e todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos. 

Viveu sempre em Boane provincia de Maputo, é ferramenteira na Macaté  ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 13.000.00mt por mês juntando com o rendimento do seu marido, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a sua casa (ferro, areia, pedra, chapas, cimento e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do material na sua casa. 
Pretende concluir a sua obra para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ecelina was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. She went to school through the tenth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone but her children.

She's always lived in Boane, in the province of Maputo. She's been making tools in Macaté for more than two years and she and earns about 13,000 meticals a month. Together with her husband's earnings, they are able to cover their household expenses and save some in their bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (iron, sand, stone, sheet metal, cement, etc.) to continue work on her house.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish her house so she can provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron, sand, stone, sheet metal, cement, etc.) for her house.

loans.name: Renaldo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo , Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filho ainda sem idade Escolar. Fez 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Maputo para Boane a procura de emprego, é funcionario na ARA-SUL ha mais de 17 anos e tem um salario de 6.420.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BCI).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, ferro, pedra, pregos e outros) para dar continuidade. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, 14.000.00mt, 14.500.00mt, 20.000.00mt, e 22.000.00mt,ambos para a sua para a mesma finalidade.
No futuro pretende concluir a sua obra e mobiliar, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Renaldo was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name in the south of Mozambique, is married and is the father of 1 son who isn’t old enough to go to school yet. He completed 10th grade and did not continue his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

Renaldo left Maputo for Boane looking for a job. He has been an employee at ARA-SUL for more than 17 years and has a monthly salary of 6,420.00 meticals (MZN) which he uses for household expenses and saves in his bank account (at BCI).

He has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his sixth loan with Hluvuku for the value of 26,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase construction materials to continue building his house (cement, iron, stone, nails and others). The first loans were for: 10,000.00 MZN, 14,000.00 MZN, 14,500.00 MZN, 20,000.00 MZN and 22,000.00 MZN, all for the same ends.

In future he intends to complete his build work and furnish his home, for which he will solicit more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials to continue building his house (cement, iron, stone, nails and others)

loans.name: C1921 Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Claire is 32 years old and she is single. She owns a business selling second hand clothes in the market. She is the leader of this group, which is called "UMUCYO", in the local language which, in English, means "LIGHT" (She is the second person on the right side in the photo). Claire has been in this business for about three years. 

Claire and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their clothes business to sell. Claire and her team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos que ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez o ensino superior e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Maputo devido aos estudos, é professora na EPC 4 de Outubro ha mais de 22 anos e tem um salario de 9.700.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem nenhumas dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, blocos, e outros), para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos tambem foram para a mesma actividade.
Pretende concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Leonor was born in the District of Manjacaze, in the Province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique, is married and is the mother of 5 children who are still in School. She completed her university degree but didn't continue with her studies due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She left her hometown for Maputo to pursue her studies. She has been a teacher at 'EPC 4 de Outubro' for more than 22 years and has a monthly salary of 9,700.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenditures and saves in her bank account (BIM). 

She has had loans from other banks and has managed to pay these off without any difficulties. She came to know of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her sixth loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 25,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase materials for her house (sand, cement, stone, blocks and others) to continue with the build work on her house. Her first loans were also for this activity. 

Leonor intends to complete her house and purchase a vehicle to increase the comfort of her family and as such, she will be soliciting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase materials for her house (sand, cement, stone, blocks and others)

loans.name: Emerciana

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos  que ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades  financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de  sua terra natal para Boane com sua familia ainda muito jovem, é comerciante ha mais de 4 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 11.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos comerciaiais (amendoim, arroz, sumos, refrescos, vinhos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro vai manter o seu negocio mais forte e construir uma casa maior, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Emerciana was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She and her family left Maputo for Boane when she was still very young. She's had a shop for more than four years and earns about 11,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account.
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy commercial products (peanuts, rice, juice, soft drinks, wines, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
She intends to request more loans from Hluvuku to keep her business strong and build a larger house.

loans.use: to buy commercial products (peanuts, rice, juice, soft drinks, wines, etc.).

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia Tete, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 5ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Saiu da sua terra natal Tete para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, é comerciante e pensionista no Ministerio da defesa ha mais de 10 anos, tem uma  pensão de 8.500.00mt por mês e um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos (BARCLAYS) no valor de 28.000.00mt, o qual conseguiu pagar sem nenhumas dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu setimo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, arroz,sumos,  e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de:13.274.00mt, 4.200.00mt,  19.762.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 23.649.00mt e 15.000.00mt para o negocio.
 No futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial e adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o escoamento dos produtos assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Manuel was born in the province of Tete in northern Mozambique. He is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. He went to school through the fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Tete for Maputo in search of a better life. He has a business and has been retired from the Ministry of Defense for more than 10 years. He has a pension of 8,500 meticals a month and earns 5,000 meticals a month from his business. He uses his earnings to cover household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He had a loan from another bank (Barclays) in the amount of 28,000 meticals, which he paid off without any problems. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his seventh loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries. His other loans were in the amounts of 13,274, 4,200, 19,762, 5,000, 23,649, and 15,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand his business and acquire a vehicle to make transporting his merchandise easier.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling beans and simsim (sesame seeds) in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Monica requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to be able to purchase more beans and simsim for sale. The extra income will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and simsim for sale.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn has run her sewing business for almost 23 years. She is 45 years of age and married with four children. Now, Roselyn would like to improve the dresses she's made in order to encourage more customers to buy her products. She couldn't achieve this goal without sufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. With this loan, she can buy garments, threads and other accessories needed for her sewing business. In addition, this loan will help her to greatly increase her production, as she has many orders to deliver. She hopes to be able to maintain her business, which enables her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy garments, threads and other accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois netos que vivem com ele. 
Saiu da sua terra natal Inhambane para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, é comerciante ha mais de 15 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, arroz, sumos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 8.000.00mt, para o negocio.
Pretende solicitar mais valor no futuro para ampliar a sua actividade comercial comprando uma viatura, para tal  irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is married and has six children, four of whom are still in school. He went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports two grandchildren who live with them.
He left Inhambane for Maputo in search of a better life. He's had a shop for more than 15 years and earns 5,000 meticals a month. He uses his earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries. His first loan was in the amount of 8,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand his business by purchasing a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, fish, rice, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 21 years old, single, and lives with his family in the village of Bacolod, in the Angadanan municipality of the Isabela province. At his young age, Roger is willing to work hard every single day to provide their daily needs.

Roger wants to continue to manage the business so that he can earn and save money for the future emergencies. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farming business. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farming business.

loans.name: Fausa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 5 ainda frequentam a Escola. Frequenta as aulas de alfabetização, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane porcurando melhores condicoes de vida, é comerciante ha mais de 20 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, batata, peixe, arroz, sumos,  e outros) para aumentar a a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 12.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, todos para o  negocio.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para melhorar a sua casa e ampliar a sua actividade comercial, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fausa was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of six children, five of whom go to school. She is taking literacy classes. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She left Maputo for Boane in search of a better life. She's had a business for more than 20 years and earns 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account.
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (oil, sweet potatoes, fish, rice, juice, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. Her other loans were in the amounts of 12,000, 15,000, and 20,000 meticals, which she also invested in her business.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to improve her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products (oil, sweet potatoes, fish, rice, juice, etc.).

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, Provincia de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 já concluiram os estudos e para 1 frequenta a 10ª classe. Fez 4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e  sustenta mais 2 netos, sua mãe e sua sogra que vivem com ela. 

Saiu da sua terra natal com os pais ainda pequena, é comerciante ambulante ha mais de 13 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a sua casa (areia, cimento, blocos, barrotes, e outros).
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
