Etelvina was born in the district of Homoine, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children; three of them have finished their studies and the other is in the tenth grade. She went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports two grandchildren, her mother, and her mother-in-law, who live with them.

She and her parents left Homoine when she was still small. She's been selling products door to door for more than 13 years and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account.
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, cinder blocks, rebar, etc.) to continue construction on her house.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so she can complete and furnish her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, cinder blocks, rebar, etc.) for her house.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, who is 31 years old, is a farmer. By feeding pigs, she earns $2 per day. Her husband buys and sells cows, earning $5 per day. The couple has two children, aged three years old and two months old. Every month, they have to spend $42 on food and $15 on transportation.

Thy would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows for resale. The loan will help the family decrease their transportation expenses and enable her husband to run his business well. Thy wants to build a cow stable that is bigger and nicer to keep the cows that her husband has bought for resale.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows for resale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, a 43-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Lordjim, an overseas contract worker, and a mother of three children. She and her husband manage the household while operating the business. At this time, Julieta is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Julieta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Julieta is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julieta hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies with the group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe e a sua irmã enviando dinheiro. 

Saiu da sua terra natal Gaza para Maputo no Distrito de Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida é alfaiate e comerciante ha mais de 26 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao da sua casa (pedra, blocos, areia, barrotes, e outros.) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, todos para o seu negocio.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a obra da sua casa, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armando was born in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children, all of whom attend school. He went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother and sister financially, sending them money to help with their expenses.

He left Gaza for Maputo in the district of Boane in search of a better life. He's been a tailor for more than 26 years and earns about 6,000 meticals a month. He uses his earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his fifth loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (stone, cinder blocks, sand, rebar, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 10,000, and 20,000 meticals, were both used for his business.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (stone, cinder blocks, sand, rebar, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 44 years old and is married with seven children between 6 and 21 years of age. He also takes care of one person. He owns a mill, milling different products like sorghum, cassava flour, and peanuts. Celestin has been in this business for six years and is open from 8am until 6pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. 

Celestin has requested a loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his mill by buying new materials to help it function. With any profits, he would like to save money and reinvest in this business. He also hopes to buy a new mill.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying new materials for his mill.

loans.name: Samart

texts.en: Samart, who is 39 years old, buys and sells recycled items in Phnom Penh City, earning $4 per day. Samart doesn’t have any children and lives with her parents, who are farmers earning $3 per day. Every month, Samart has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rent, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a plot of land for farming. The loan will help her have a field that can provide some rice to support her family. She also wants to expand the area at her house where she stocks recycled items to sell when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Kokuvi

texts.fr:
Kokuvi est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est célibataire.  
Kokuvi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2007. Il achète et revend des cartes de recharge de téléphone à tous ceux qui le désire, dans une cabine téléphonique à un carrefour non loin d’une station d’essence. Il achète les cartes auprès des grossistes du quartier. Il travaille avec une personne. 
Kokuvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge destinées à la vente. Il veut avec les profits supplémentaires agrandir sa baraque. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kokuvi voudrait devenir grossiste. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit dans un avenir proche avoir une meilleure condition de vie.
texts.en:
Kokuvi is a single man who is 28 years old.

Kokuvi has been working as a retailer since 2007.  He buys and sells top-up cards for phones to everybody who wants them.  He makes his sales from a phone booth at a crossroads not far from a gas station.  He buys his cards from wholesalers in his neighborhood.  He works with the help of one other person.

Kokuvi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy top-up cards to sell.  He would like to use his extra profits to increase the size of his sales location.

In the coming years, Kokuvi would like to become a wholesaler.  He says that he plans to use his profits to improve his living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy top-up cards

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 8 filhos dos quais 3 maiores e 5 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane a procura de emprego, é carpinteiro ha mais de 30 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao  da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 15.000.00mt,para a obra.
No futuro solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa  e adiquirir uma viatura, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Luis was born in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He’s married and the father of 8 children, 3 of whom are of age and 5 who still attend School. He completed 3rd grade and didn’t continue his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn’t support anyone else.

He left his hometown for Boane looking for a job and has been a carpenter for more than 30 years. He has a monthly salary of 8,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he spends on household expenses and saves in his bank account.

Luis has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his second loan at Hluvuku for the value of 20,000.00 MZN with which he intends to purchase construction materials for his house (sand, cement, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work. His first loan was for 15,000.00 MZN, also for the building work.

In future he intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku to complete the build of his house and purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his house (sand, cement, stone, iron and others)

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en: Sergia is a 57-year-old married woman from Talibon. She is a farmer and owns her own land. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Sergia is happy to be earning from her farm. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and to pay for her children's school fees. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor is 52 years old. She is a farmer and earns $2 per day. Her husband buys and sells cattle and earns $3 per day. They have two children, and all of them are working. Each earns $2.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $42 on food, $5 on electricity and $20 on rent. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy cattle to sell. The loan will help her husband to have enough money to continue his career that makes some income for the famiL.. The couple plan to buy more land for farming and to buy more cattle to sell when they can save enough money to start.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 2ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao da sua casa  (barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, todos  para construção da casa.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor no futuro para concluir a sua casa e oferecer mais conforto a sua familia e ira solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Samuel was born in the District of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique, is the father of 4 children, 2 of whom are still in School. He completed 2nd grade and didn't continue with his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He has been a trader for more than 8 years and has a monthly income of around 5,000.00 MZN which he uses on household expenses and saves in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku for the amount of 17,000.00 MZN with which he intends to purchase construction materials for his house (beams, sand, stone, iron and others) to continue with the construction of his home. His first loans were for 5,000.00 MZN, 7,000.00 MZN, 10,000.00 MZN and 15,000.00 MZN, all for the construction of his home.

In future he intends to solicit more loans to conclude the build of his house and offer his family more comfort and he will also solicit more loans from Hluvuku to build a commercial establishment.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his house (beams, sand, stone, iron and others)

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 22 years old. She is married with 2 children. Irene has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Irene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Irene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang is 28 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has been living and working in the Baray district for ages. Besides cultivating seasonal crops, Mrs. Leang has operated a selling business in her community. Her business is running smoothly with many loyal customers who come to buy regularly. She sells mixed items like sweets, groceries, packaged noodles or foods, canned foods and drinks. Typically, she yields a profit of $3 USD per day by selling her products. 

Mrs. Leang has noticed that most of the villagers there have difficulties, especially when they want to husk their rice; they have to go far away from the village and take more time to transport the rice back and forth. In an attempt to generate additional profits, Mrs. Leang is seeking a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to buy a rice-husking machine and start up a new business by providing rice-husking services in and around the community. With the rest of the loan, she’ll purchase more rice to husk for selling. With her profits, she plans to fix her house partially and save some money for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy a rice-husking machine and to purchase more rice to husk for selling.

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos onde todos frequentam a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Vive no Distrito de Boane provincia de Maputo ha mais de 10 anos, é militar ha 27 anos e recebe uma pensão de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da sua casa (cimento, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.600.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, todos para a sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julio was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of three children, all of whom are in school. He completed school through the 6th grade himself, but wasn't able to continue out of financial constraints. He lives in his own home with his family, which he supports.

He has lived in the Boane district of Maputo Province for more than 10 years and has been in the military for 27 years, receiving a monthly salary of 7,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], which goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.    

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his sixth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials for his house (bricks, metal, cement, etc.). His prior loans were in the amount of 5,600, 8,000, 10,000, 15,000, and 20,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], all of which were for this work. He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish his home and provide a more comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house (bricks, metal, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 38 year old married woman with one child, who is in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to allow her to purchase more charcoal for sale. The extra income from this loan will be used to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita lives in a village where you can find housewives busy in their daily activities such as vending food and personal products, fruits and vegetables and backyard hog raising. Teresita is involved in personal products sales- selling cosmetics, perfumes, and slippers to the people in the village. She has been offering these items for almost three years and earns a profit of P2,000 each month. 

She needs to diversify her business to gain more profit. She has insufficient funds which is why she is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy colognes, perfumes, lipstick, shampoos, and soaps to offer and sell.

In the future, Teresita would like to establish a permanent stall in front of her house for a more convenient place to stock the items offered to her customers.

loans.use: to buy colognes, perfumes, lipstick, shampoo, and soaps to sell

loans.name: Henrique

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 8 filhos dos quais 7 maiores de idade e apenas um ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

saiu da sua terra natal para o Distrito de Boane para constituir sua familia, trabalha como motorista na Funeraria Moçambicana ha mais de 26 anos e tem um salario de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da sua casa (cimento, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, também para a sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa, e comprar uma viatura para o transporte da sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Henrique was born in the district of Marracuene, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of eight children, seven of whom are adults and one of whom is still in school. He went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

He left Marracuene for the district of Boane to start his family. He's worked as a driver for the Funeraria Moçambicana for more than 26 years and earns 4,500 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves some in a bank account.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to continue construction on his house. His first loan was in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he also used for the construction.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house and buy a car for his family to use.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to continue construction on his house.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is from the village of Bacolod, Cauayan City, Isabela.  He is 32 years old, married and has one school-aged child. Because of his determination to improve his family's living situation, he does everything to attain a prosperous living in the future. 

Due to the high cost of tuition fees and commodities, Nestor is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his corn farm business. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. He believes that through his patience in managing his farm business he will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his corn farm business

loans.name: Francis Mwolo

texts.en:
Francis is a 42-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 15 years. He describes himself as being hardworking, patient and trustworthy.

He operates a knitting-services business where he makes and sells pullovers and sweaters for school-going children. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a slum area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonality and low purchasing power by his customers.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy yarns for making sweaters. His business goal is to to diversify into farming within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will purchase a tractor for using on his farm, buy a plot of land and put up rental houses.

loans.use: to buy knitting yarns

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 5 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez  9ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal Cabo Delgado para Maputo em missão de serviço, é militar ha mais de 42 anos e tem uma pensão de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos na Associação PFUCANE e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 14.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da sua casa (pedra, areia, barrotes, chapas, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 2.500.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 13.000.00mt para a construção da sua casa.
Pretende concluir a sua casa e mobiliar para melhor confortar a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cornelio was born in the province of Cabo Delgado, in northern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 6 children, 5 of whom attend school.  He attended school through the 9th grade, but did not finish due to financial circumstances.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he does not support anyone else.  

He left his homeland of Cabo Delgado for Maputo for military service.  He has been in the military for more than 42 years and has a pension of 5.000.00mt per month.  He uses it to pay for household expenses and he saves some in his bank account. 

He previously had loans through Associação PFUCANE and was able to pay them off without any issues.  He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 14.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction materials for his home (stone, sand, beams, metal panels, etc.).  The prior loans were for 2.500.000mt, 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, and 13.000.00mt, also for the construction of his home.  

He plans to finish his home and equip it to provide better comfort to his family.  He will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase home construction materials (stones, sand, beams,metal panels, etc.)

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is a 64-year-old married woman. She tills a rice farm in Talibon, Bohol, where she also lives with her family. Basilia earns 5,000 PHP per month from rice farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Basilia hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. She also wants to be able to extend help to her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 22 years old.  He is married with 1 child.

Ronnie has a store involved in rice retailing. He has had this business for 2 years.  He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional rice to sell.

Ronnie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ronnie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for retail selling

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais todos são maiores de idade. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Saiu da sua terra natal para distrito de Boane ainda em Maputo, é comerciante ha mais de 18 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.200.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Já teve emprestimos na CCOM e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades nenhumas, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada, para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 7.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, ambos para o negocio. 
Pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial e diversificar a sua mercadoria, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Joana was born in the Namaacha district, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is divorced and the mother of 4 adult children.  She completed school through the 6th grade but did not continue due to her financial situation.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  

She left her homeland for the district of Boane, also in Maputo.  She has been a trader/seller for more than 18 years and earns around 5.200.00mt per month.  She uses this for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (BIM).

She previously had loans with CCOM and was able to pay them back without any difficulties.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase bundles of used clothes, to increase her stock of merchandise.  The first loans were for 7.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt, both for her business.  She plans to construct a shop and diversify the products she sells, and she will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is an owner of a general store which is located within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. She has been operating it for almost six years and she is able to earn about 5,000 PHP a month. She uses her generated income to meet their daily needs, for an allowance for the children and electric bill payment. 

Norie is 39 years of age, married and has four children. One of her children has finished the college level while the three left are still studying. Norie suffered from financial matters due to the expenses of her three children so, to increase her sales and profit, she is asking for additional capital amounting to 7,000 PHP to buy more groceries for her general store. In this way, she could increase her profit and provide her children with good educations. In addition, she could improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her general store

loans.name: Maly

texts.en: Maly, 37 years old, is a banana seller and a tailor, and she earns $3 per day. Her husband is a Tok Tok (motorcycle taxi) driver and earns $10 per day. The couple have three children, all of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a new Tok Tok for her husband’s career. The previous Tok Tok is old and needs a lot of repairing. Before, the couple fed pigs at home, but they did not get any profit and lost their principle, so they decided to stop and start a new career. She plans to produce wine to sell at home, but this business need a lot of principle, so now they are trying to save the money to start it.

loans.use: To buy a new Tok Tok (motorcycle taxi) for her husband's career

loans.name: C 2011 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Hasina is 53 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of 13 and 31 years old. She owns a business selling pineapples, passion fruits, apples, beans, vegetables and so on. She is the leader of this group, which is called "ABAHUJE" in the local language (she is the third person from the left side in the photo, in the white scarf). Hasina has been in this business for about two years. 

Hasina and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their quantities of pineapples, passion fruits, apples, beans, vegetables and so on, to sell. Hasina and her team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by cultivating more vegetables, fruits etc. to sell.

loans.name: Searn

texts.en:
Mrs. Searn is a 60-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray District of Kompong Thom Province. She is a widowed woman who currently lives with four single children. Three of her children are employed in various jobs, earning profits to share responsibilities with Mrs. Searn. 

To make a daily income, Mrs. Searn provides a sewing clothes service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes in Baray market. She runs her business very well and her many customers recognize the good service she provides. She is able to make an income, on average, of $2.40 per day to cover financial expenses for the whole family. Mrs. Searn will use all of her loan to buy more clothes for her sewing business. 

In the future, Mrs. Searn hopes, with her increase income, she will be able to open a new shop for her cloth-sewing business. She also hopes to make her house bigger than it is at the present time.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her sewing business.

loans.name: Ivete

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho que ainda não tem idade Escolar. Fez 12ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal Maputo, reside no distrito de Boane, é comerciante ha mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 8.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar roupas e carteiras para a revenda. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 15.000.00mt e foi para o negocio.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para ampliar o seu negocio e construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku
texts.en:
Ivete was born in the city of Matola in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is a single mother of one son who is still below school age. She completed school herself through the 12th grade, but wasn't able to continue out of financial constraints. She lives in her own home with her family, which she supports.

She has never left her native province of Maputo and lives in the Boane district. She has been a vendor for more than 8 years and makes a monthly earning of 8,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] that goes to her household expenses and also some savings in her personal bank account.  

She has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which she plans to buy clothes and purses for resale. Her first loan was in the amount of 15,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for this business.

She plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to grow her business and build a comercial establishment.

loans.use: to buy and sell assorted clothing items.

loans.name: Esther Mawia

texts.en: Esther is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from six years to twelve years. She describes herself to be quiet and likes sharing ideas. She operates a retail shop where she sells items such as rice, sugar, bread, flour, and detergents. She has been involved in this business for fourteen years. Her business is located in a busy shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cereals for selling at the retail shop. Her business goal is to grow her business into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell at the general store

loans.name: Mea

texts.en: Mea is 33 years old. She is married with three children. Mea has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Mea has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo is 66 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. He is married with seven children. Bernardo works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for four years. He has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials. Bernardo has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun, 48 years old, is a farmer and animal feeder and earns $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns $3 per day. This couple has four children, two are studying, one is working and earns $2.5 per day and one more is only five years old. Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $10 on electricity, $35 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work. She also wants to buy a threshing machine for a new career at home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house (cinder blocks, sand, cement, rocks, etc.)

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 47, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines.  She is married to Florante, an aircraft maintenance worker, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.  Currently she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Rosalinda operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5 pesos of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  Aside from this Rosalinda and her husband also have a small computer shop.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalinda dreams to grow her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her children will have a good future.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth, 47 years old, is a grocery seller earning $3 per day.  Her husband sells ice-cream, earning $2 per day.  They have five children, three are studying and two more are working.  Each earns $3 per day.  Every month, Reth has to spend $30 on food, $15 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy cattle to sell.  The loan will help her husband to start a new career that can earn further income.  She also plans to extend her grocery store by buying more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Guijá, provincia de Gaza , sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais todos ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 11ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal Gaza para Maputo em Boane a procura de emprego, é coordenadora dos activistas na area de HIV-SIDA na Assoção PFUCANE ha mais de 5 anos e tem um salario de 11.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos (TCHUMA) para o negocio e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para obra da sua casa (areia, pedra, barrotes, ferro, e outros).  Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 20.000.00mt, e 25.000.00mt, para concluir a obra da sua casa.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir o murro da sua casa para oferecer mais  segurança a sua familia assim, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Esperanca was born in the district of Guijá, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is unmarried and has three children, two of whom are still in school. She went to school through the eleventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She left Gaza for Maputo, in Boane, to find a job. She has been a coordinator for HIV/AIDS activists in the Assoção PFUCANE for more than five years and earns about 11,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in her bank account.
She's had loans from other banks (Tchuma) for her business, which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 12,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.) to build a house. Her first loans, in the amounts of 20,500 and 25,000 meticals, were both used on the house.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish the wall around her house so she can offer her family more security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.) for her house.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 47 years old, married and blessed with three school-aged children.  To make a living, he has been growing corn for almost fifteen years.  He earnt 35,000 Phillipine pesos (PHP) at the last cropping.  He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm business.  He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs.  He hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve his family's status in life.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm business.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang, 37 years old, is a policeman and earns $3 per day. His wife is an animal seller and earns $3 per day. This couple has four children, three are studying and one is too young to go to school. Every month, he has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. He would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy more pigs to feed. Leang doesn’t want to do other things besides his current job and feeding pigs at home because he wants his wife staying home to take care of the children.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, iron, cement, etc.) to continue construction on his house.

loans.name: Nomelita

texts.en:
Nomelita is 32 years old.  She is married with one child.  Nomelita has a store in which she sells her boiled duck eggs as a food supplement. These eggs are rich in protein and other minerals.  She has had this business twenty years.  She requested a loan for 15,000 Philipine pesos (PHP) to buy more stocks of duck eggs to sell.

Nomelita has been a member of Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation Inc. (HSPFI) since 2011.  In the future, Nomelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boiled duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Silva

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de um filho que ainda não tem idade Escolar. Fez a 8ª classe e fez o curso de Electrecidade. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é Electrecista na empresa SUPER-STEEL ha mais de 1 ano e tem um salario de 10.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para obra da sua casa (chapas, areia, pedra, barrotes, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade com o projecto. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 3.000.00mt, e 6.000.00mt, para habitacao.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e oficializar a sua relação, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Silva was born in the Boane District in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is the single father of one son, who is not yet of school age. He completed school through the 8th grade himself and attended Electrician classes. He lives in his own home with his family, which he supports.

He has never left his home area and has been an electrician with the Super-Steel firm for over a year, earning a monthly salary of 10,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], which goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.    

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 12,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials for his house (sheet metal, gravel, stone, bricks, steel, etc.) to keep going with his project. His prior loans were in the amount of 3,000 and 6,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for housing costs as well.

In the future, he plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish his home and solidify his position.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house (sheet metal, gravel, stone, bricks, steel, etc.).

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a 49-year-old married woman.  She has five children whose ages range from six years to twenty-one years.  She describes herself to be God fearing and humble.  

She operates a a water distribution services business where she sells water to the local people in Kisumu.  She has been involved in this business for fourteen years.  Her business is located in a densely populated slum area.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more water and water storage containers.  Her business goal is to grow it into a big business within five years.  

She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more water and water containers.

loans.name: Zubaidullo

texts.ru: Зубайдулло женат имеет шестерых детей. На воспитание и содержание семьи у него большие расходы. Но эти свои расходы он покрывает работой на земле – выращиванием  сельхозпродуктов. Работа на земле  требует тщательного ухода. Вместе с женой они работают на поле и получают немалые доходы. В последнее время минеральные удобрения подорожали и поэтому для покупки минеральных удобрений Зубайдулло хочет получить займ. Часть займа он также будет потратить для оплаты рабочей силы.
texts.en: Zubaidullo is married and has six children.  His child rearing and family support expenses are very high, but he covers his expenses by working on the land - growing agricultural products.  Work on the land requires diligent care.  Together with his wife, they work on the field and earn a good income.  Lately, mineral fertilizers went up in price and Zubaidullo wants to obtain a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.  He wants to also use some of the loan funds to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and also to pay for labor

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Thary, 40 years old, is a farmer and tailor earning $1 per day.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver earning $6 per day.  They have four children; one is studying, two more are working in the factory.  Each earns $3 per day, and one more is only five years old.  Every month, Thary has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.  

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs to feed and sell.  She wants to feed more pigs S. she can get a better income.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos que ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez 8ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para o distrito d Boane a procura de emprego, é pedreiro mestre de obras ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para o bra da sua casa (chapas, areia, pedra, barrotes, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade com o projecto da sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, para tal irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alexandre was born in Sofala Province in central Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children, all of whom are in school. He completed school through the 8th grade himself, but wasn't able to continue out of financial constraints. He lives in his own home with his family, which he supports.

He left his native region for the Boane District of Maputo in search of work. He has been a stone mason for more than 10 years and earns a monthly salary of nearly 5,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] that goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.  

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 12,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials for his house (sheet metal, gravel, stone, bricks, metal, etc.). He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish his home and provide a more comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house (sheet metal, gravel, stone, bricks, metal, etc.).

loans.name: Eunice Awuor

texts.en: Eunice is a 40-year-old widowed woman. She has five children, ranging from 6 to 20 years old. She describes herself as God-fearing and humble. Eunice operates a water-distribution services business where she sells water to the local people in Kisumu. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a densely populated slum area. She says her biggest business challenge is insecurity. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more water and water storage containers. Her goal is to grow her business into a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more water and water storage containers.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 62 years old and lives in Sapang Ama. She is married and has seven children. Avelina is engaged in a nipa-palm-weaving business. She earns approximately 3500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,999 PHP to purchase nipa palm and rattan for her weaving business. Avelina has been a member of PMPC for 20 years.

loans.use: to purchase nipa palm and rattan for her weaving business.

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Narciso

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e se formou como policial. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane quando decidiu engrenar na policia, é policia afecto no Comando Provincial ha mais de 24 anos e tem um salario de 8.633.33mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos (BIM) a longo prazo, e concluiu o pagamento sem dificuldade. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da construção de uma capoeira (areia, cimento, pedra, barrotes, e outros.) para fazer a criacao de frangos.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a capoeira para ampliar a sua actividade comercial,  assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Narciso was born in Homoine District, Inhambane Province, southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of five children, three of whom still attend school. He completed grade 12 and trained as a police officer. He lives in his own home with his family, and supports his parents. He sends them money to help pay their household costs.

He left his hometown and came to Boane when he decided to join the police. He has been working in the provincial police department for more than 24 years. He has a salary of over 8,000 Mozambican Meticals per month. He uses this for household expenses, and saves some in his bank account.

He has already had long-term loans with other banks (BIM) in the past, and completed the payments without difficulty. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, and is for the amount of 13,000 Mozambican Meticals. With the loan he will buy construction materials to build a chicken shed/coop (sand, cement, stones, planks/beams, and others) so that he can raise chickens. In the future he plans to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can complete the chicken coop and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a chicken shed/coop (sand, cement, stones, planks and others)

loans.name: Houy

texts.en: Houy, 37 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $3 per day. Her husband sells palm fruit, and he earns $5 per day. The couple has three children; two are studying and one works in a factory, earning $3 per day. Every month, Houy has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy more grocery goods to sell. She wants to support her children to study and at least finish secondary school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is married and has five children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. Mila is a farmer and grows assorted crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs as her new business. Mila has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos que ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo em Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, é comerciante ha mais de 13 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açucar, oleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para melhorar o seu negocio e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in Inhambane Province, southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of three children who still attend school. He completed grade 7 but did not continue due to financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and supports his parents who live with him.

He left Inhambane for Boane in Maputo Province, as he was looking to improve his life. He has been a businessman for more than 13 years. He has a salary of around 8,000 Mozambican Meticals per month. He uses this for household expenses, and saves some in his bank account.
He has never had loans with other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, and is for the amount of 25,000 Mozambican Meticals. With the loan he will buy food products (rice, flour, sugar, oil and others) to increase the stock in his store. He promises to pay without problems and in the future he intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to improve his business and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in his shop (rice, flour, sugar, oil and others)

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Hean, 64 years old, is a rice seller who earns $2 per day. Her husband is a worker who earns $2 per day. The couple has one child, 15 years old, who stays at home. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a stock of rice to sell for a good price. She wants to support her child in studying a skill although now he does not know the skill he wants to study.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mergin

texts.en:
Mergin is 45 years old.  She is married with three children.

Mergin has a store that sells sweet coolers like halo halo and fruit salad.  She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Phillipine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional things needed, like boxes and ingredients in making the food products to sell.

Mergin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future Mergin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes for food products and ingredients to sell fruit salad.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is 37 years old, married and blessed with one child.  Loreto has been engaged in a rice farming business for seven years.  Loreto’s income in his business depends on the farm inputs he has used and the climate.

Loreto compares his yield when planting hybrid and inbred rice.  He observes that he gets a high yield when he plants hybrid seeds of rice.  Loreto’s practice is planting inbred rice seeds because he does not have enough capital to buy hybrid seeds because they are costly.  But Loreto desires to get a high yield of crops and therefore he is asking for a loan of 20,000 Phillipine pesos (PHP) to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizers to use in rice farming.

Loreto hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on his rice farming business. With the loan he may be able to achieve a high production of rice.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizers to use in rice farming.

loans.name: Jephris Nyakowa

texts.en:
Jephris is a widowed woman.  She has eight children with ages ranging from seven years to twenty-two years. She describes herself as humble. 

She operates a fish selling business where she sells fish to the local people.  She has been involved in this business for six years.  Her business is located in a busy shopping centre in Kisumu.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase her stock of fish.  Her business goal is to grow her business to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish.

loans.name: Nellie Group

texts.en:
Nellie is 43 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao. She is married and has two children. 

Nellie has a hog raising business and earns approximately 5600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs. 

Nellie has been a member of PMPC for two years. Nellie is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of feed for her hogs

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Tete, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos já maiores de idade. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatorio. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 netos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Tete para  Maputo no Distrito de Boane quando foi transferido como militar, é pensionista militar ha mais de 25 anos e tem pensão de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros). O anterior foi de 15.000.00mt e foi aplicado na habitacao.
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para melhorar ainda mais a sua casa e criar gado suino.
texts.en:
Jose was born in the province of Tete in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two adult children. He went to school through the third grade but dropped out in order to complete his compulsory military service. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports three grandchildren who live with him.

He left Tete for Maputo in the district of Boane when he was transferred there as a soldier. He retired from the military after 25 years and earns a pension of 4,500 meticals a month. He uses the pension to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. The previous loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, was also used for the house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to further improve his house and start raising pigs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Sukea

texts.en:
Sukea, 26, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $2.90 per day. They have one child who is three years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $6 on electricity, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to use for traveling to work. Sukea wants to open a grocery shop to sell along the road when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her and her husband to use for traveling to work

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhuon, 46, is a farmer from the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She has resided and worked there since she was a young girl. Now she is married to Mr. Sreang and has three children. They grow seasonal crops such as rice, potatoes and some kinds of beans as well. When their crops are ripe, they cut and collect them, taking them home for daily meals and to the market for selling. Together, this couple makes a good profit of $8 each day to cover their financial needs and support their children's schooling. 

Mrs. Chhuon said that it is very difficult to go anywhere without her own motorcycle because she has to spend money to take a motor-taxi service every day. Thus, Mrs. Chhuon is taking out a loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to buy a motorcycle. It will reduce some expenses and provide good transportation without taking any taxi services. In the future, she wants to expand her business and her current house extensively.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Boy Samson

texts.en:
Boy Samson is 39 years old and lives in Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City. He is married and has three children. 

Boy Samson has a fruit vending business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his fruit vending business. 

Boy Samson has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his fruit vending business

loans.name: Anuar

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Mandjacaze, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta  seus pais que  vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Mandjacaze para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, é pensionista militar ha mais de 17 anos e tem pensão de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro  emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 14.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros).  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para concluir a sua casa e mobiliar.
texts.en:
Anuar was born in the district of Mandjacaze, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of six children, four of whom still attend school. He went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his parents, who live with him.

He left Mandjacaze for Boane in search of a better life. He has been retired from the military for more than 17 years and earns a pension of 4,500 meticals a month. He uses the pension to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.
He's had loans from other banks, which he paid off without any problems. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 14,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Monette

texts.en:
Monette is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Monette has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Monette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Monette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Safuli

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Cabo Delgado, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Cabo Delgado para Maputo no distrito de Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, trabalha como serralheiro ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia,  blocos, cimento, pedra e outros).   
No futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir uma oficina para aumentar o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Safuli was born in the province of Cabo Delgado in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children, three of whom still attend school. He went to school through seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

He left Cabo Delgado for Maputo in the district of Boane in search of a better life. He's been a locksmith for more than 10 years and earns about 8,500 meticals a month. He uses his earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to complete his house and furnish it.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, stone, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 29, sells sour fruit (mango) and earns $7 per day. Her husband is a chief of construction workers and earns $8 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is only five years old. 

Every day she has to spend $77 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $5 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband traveling to work and other uses in the family.

Her husband wants to study more skills related to construction so that he can have improved skills to provide a better service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Chuluunerdene

texts.en:
Chuluunerdene is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife stays at home and watches her youngest daughter while the older two children go to kindergarten. 

Chuluunerdene started his taxi service business in 2006 by buying his own car. Since then he has built his own garage and got many regular customers. Now that winter is approaching he needs his car to be repaired for the harsh winter in Mongolia. He is requesting 600,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and winter oil for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and winter oil

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais dois ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Possui uma residencia que faz aluguer ha mais de 2 anos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua segunda casa (ferro, areia, pedra, cimento e outros).  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua casa e mobiliar.
texts.en:
Olga was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children, two of whom are still in school. She attended school through the eleventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports two nephews who live with her.

She's had a guesthouse for more than 2 years and earns about 2,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account (BIM).
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 12,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, stone, cement, etc.) to build her second house.
She is committed to paying off this loan in full and on time, and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her house and furnish it.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, stone, cement, etc.) to build her second house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products (peanuts, fish, beer, and so on) to sell.

loans.name: Genebeb

texts.en:
Genebeb is 31 years old. She is married with 2 children.
 
Genebeb has a stall where she sells natural food supplements known as Balut Penoy, or boiled duck eggs. According to much research this good is rich in protein and some food minerals. Genebeb has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional eggs to sell to sustain the business.

Genebeb has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genebeb hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional  Duck Eggs to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 32 years old and lives in Upper Langcagan, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. Mary Grace has a RTW  business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase clothes for her clothing business. Mary Grace has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Vive no Distrito de Boane desde a sua infancia com seus pais e constitui sua familia no mesmo Distrito. É comerciante ha mais de 14 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo no banco (GGLS) a 6 anos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( sumos, feijão, amendoim, peixe, cervejas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.  
No futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para fazer crescer a sua actividade comercial e melhorar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Cacilda was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is single and has three school-age children. She went to school through the sixth grade, but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 

She and her parents have lived in the district of Boane since she was a child, and she started her own family there. She's had a shop for more than 14 years and earns about 15,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account (BIM).
She had a loans from another bank (GGLS) six years ago, which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 12,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
In the future she hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his crop production, Samuel spends most of his time in his farming business. He plants and harvests corn and sells it to traders. He earned approximately PHP 40,000 with his last crop. Profits earned are just enough to cover his daily expenses. 

Samuel is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He wants to ensure more crop production for this next cropping season. In the future, he would like to keep producing an abundant harvest and earn consistent profits to make his family economically stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Benard Okoth

texts.en:
Benard is a 31-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 6 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing and humble. He operates a motorcycle transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people in Kisumu. He has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a semi-urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity and accidents. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to repair his motorcycle and purchase another secondhand motorcycle. His business goal is to expand his motorcycle transport business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle and purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in his relatives' yard in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife is a teacher in the public school. His elder two kids go to school and the younger one goes to kindergarten.
