He started his transportation business in 2002 by buying his own truck. During the summer, he does construction transportation. During winter, he transports coal from a mining site and sells it in the market. He goes to the mining site 3-4 times a month. His profit from the coal business is about 300,000-400,000 MNT. He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to repair his truck and to buy new winter tires.

loans.use: To repair his truck and to buy new winter tires.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has a mini-restaurant that sells a variety of viands and other cooked foods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more ingredients to prepare foods to add to the menu. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods to add to the menu.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 57 years old and is married. She has a small store where she sells both food and daily use products, such as soap, shampoo, biscuits and canned goods, to the people in her village. She had been in this business for almost five years and earns about P3,000 a month. She operates her store inside her house where she can comfortably meet her customers' demands, even though it is not a convenient place for them to buy.

She is now requesting for a loan of P12,000 to buy eggs, breads, shampoo and soft drinks to sell in her store. These items would help increase her sales and boost up her profits.

Rosie would like to earn more income and someday construct a store in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy eggs, breads, shampoo and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Benter Akinyi

texts.en:
Benter is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 4 to 16 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing and humble. She operates a charcoal sales business where she sells charcoal to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power of the clients. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to increase her charcoal sales within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 61 years old and lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. Anita has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more feed for her pigs. Anita has been a member of PMPC 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 40 years old and a married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling dried fish in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. Charity requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 59 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 7 children. Pacita has a dried fish business and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Pacita hopes to have a space in the market. She is a hardworking mother and a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza is 22 years old. She is married with 1 child. Aiza has a shop that sells selected used clothing. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of selected used clothing to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Aiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of selected used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 56 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, he owns and operates a farm, raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earned approximately 80,000 PHP with his last crop.

At this time, Danilo wants a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his corn farm business. He dreams that his business will become more productive so he can give his family a progressive standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his corn farm business.

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.ru: Мавлудахон замужем. Живет вместе с мужем свекровью. Детей не имеет. Муж не работает. Для содержания своей семьи она  на рынке торгует национальными шарфами и платками. Головной убор, востребованный товар народов востока. От продажи платков она получает хорошие доходы. Она хочет получить займ для увеличения своего ассортимента и приобретения зимних платков и шарфов. Она надеется  получить займ.
texts.en: Mavludakhon is married and lives with her husband and mother-in-law.  She has no children.  Her husband does not work.  In order to support her family, Mavludakhon sells national shawls and scarves at the market.  A headdress is a highly demanded item in the East.  Mavludakhon earns a good income from the sales of shawls.  She wants to obtain a loan to expand the assortment of her merchandise and purchase of winter shawls and scarves.  She hopes to obtain this loan.

loans.use: to buy winter shawls and scarves

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 42 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez. She is married with 2 children. To earn a living, Maricel has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase dried fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Maricel would like to be a supplier of dried fish in her town.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en: Nemesia is 53 years old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. She is married with 4 children. Nemesia has an orchid vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase fertilizers for flowers for her business.  Nemesia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for flowers for her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 24 years old and single. She takes care of one person. Jacqueline owns a business selling electricity (cash power) to her community. This is her first successful year in this business and the hours are from 7am until 9pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her. 

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her electricity business by buying more electricity to sell, adding new goods like a printer, and buying more materials to help her in her activities. With her profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more electricity for resale and to buy a printer and more materials.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is married with 4 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Guillerma operates a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 22 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase 2 sacks of rice and additional groceries to sell. She has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Guillerma hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo is a 53-year-old woman, married to Mr. Soun, age 54; both of them are domestic rice cultivators in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. This old couple lives with two single children and a married child. One of them is working in a garment factory as a sewing worker.  The couple can earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. 

Mrs. Keo and her husband have planted a potato crop, the produce of which they will harvest and collect when it is mature. They get good results from their potato crop almost every year. Presently, Mrs. Keo and her husband have decided to seek a loan to buy more potato seeds for planting in a new season.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Whylyn

texts.en: Whylyn is 32 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children. To earn a living, Whylyn has a business selling dried fish. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Whylyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 35 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Adelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
In this group, there are four members that have different purposes of using Kiva’s funds. One of the people photographed is Mrs. Hang, 50. She is the leader of her group loan. She is in the business of rice cultivating and piglet fattening. 

Mrs. Hang has been involved in this business since 1985. She has learned well and gained a lot of experience from her business. That is why she is able to recognize how to choose good piglets for raising, how to fatten them rapidly and to avoid illnesses. Mrs. Hang typically earns $3.50 each day through this business and works hard to support the family. She decided to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. With the profits from her expanded business, she wants to buy many heads of piglets for raising.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Djamilatou

texts.fr:
Mme Djamilatou est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans.4 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du savon kabakourou, du savon fanico (provenant de la Côte d’Ivoire), du garie (farine de manioc), et de l’aloco (banane plantain) et d’autres produits alimentaires tels que: bonbons, biscuits etc. depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à la gare du train à Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de savon kabakourou,02 sac de garie(farine de manioc)et 05 régimes de banane plantain(aloco).

Mme veut agrandir son commerce avec ses économies en s’approvisionnant plus de marchandises. Elle ambitionne s’approvisionner directement en Côte d’Ivoire et revenir vendre en gros et demi-gros. Elle veut aussi contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants en payant leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djamilatou is married and the mother of five children. The eldest is 20, the youngest is 6. Out of them, four attend school. She has eight persons to support.

She's been selling kabakourou soap (made in Côte d'Ivoire), gari (cassava flour), and aloco (plantain) for five years. She gets her supplies at the Ouagadougou train station. Her customers are both women and men.

She wants to buy two sacks of kabakourou soap, two sacks of gari, and five bunches of aloco.

Mrs. Djamilatou would like to expand her business with her savings, by purchasing larger supply quantities. She ambitions to get her supplies directly in Côte d'Ivoire, in order to sell wholesale and semi-wholesale.

She also wants to help her children study by paying their school expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of soaps, two sacks of cassava flour, and five bunches of plantains

loans.name: Sharifdchon

texts.ru: Шарифчон на воспитании имеет семерых детей. Для содержания своей семьи они вместе с женой открыли цех по выпечки лепешек. Горячие лепешки это востребованный каждодневный товар на рынке. Для продвижения дела ему надо запастись мукой и углем. Для этого ему нужны средства. Шарифчон очень надеется получить займ и продвинуть свое дело вперед. Ведь для содержания большой семьи нужны большие усилия.
texts.en: Sharifdchon is raising seven children.  In order to support their family, he and his wife opened a bakery to make flatbread.  Hot flatbread is a demanded daily product at the market.  In order to continue his business, Sharifdchon needs to stock up on flour and coal and needs funds to do this.  Sharifdchon hopes very much to obtain this loan and move his business forward because a lot of efforts are needed to support a large family.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal

loans.name: Sanluke

texts.en: Sanluke is a 25-year-old single woman with no children. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. She requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 36 years old, married, and has three school aged children. Jerry is married to a loving housewife named Marites. This couple did not have the opportunity to enter college level of education because their parents had no capacity to send them to school. Thus, Jerry and his wife are working hard together to provide the best opportunity for their children.

Jerry runs a hog raising business. He started this business 10 years ago. He started with just two piglets and raised them. Now, Jerry has eight pigs to grow. He loves this business because, as he says, this serves as source of income of the family aside from farming.

Most of Jerry's profits in the hog raising business has been invested in agricultural land that they are now planting with rice. Jerry still wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of PHP40,000 to buy two additional piglets and feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to gain higher income again for the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy two additional piglets and feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 54 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are still studying. To make a living, Rudy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for 23 years and earns approximately 80,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Rudy is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is age 66 and has been in farming for over 20 years. He currently produces milk and coffee for the local market with the help of one farmhand. He is married with 8 adult children.

John has made a second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 60,000 KES to purchase a water tank. He says the tank will help provide water security for his dairy animals, in turn increasing his dairy output. He laments the persistent drought which limits farming output significantly and with much cost incurred in providing water for the animals.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 56 years old. She is married with 1 child. Nora has a piece of land cultivated with vegetables and fruit trees, which in time can be harvested with the intention to sell. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy insect sprays and fertilizers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and fertilizers for the vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам замужем имеет четверых детей. Ее муж тракторист. Бизнесом она занимается одна. Её полученные доходы помогает ей в содержании большой семьи. На рынке она торгует сельхозпродуктами-овощами. Осенью выгодно закупать овощи и фрукты. Для этого она хочет получить кредит и расширить ассортимент своих товаров.
texts.en: Mairam is married and has four children.  Her husband is a tractor driver.  She works in her business by herself.  Her earnings help her to support her large family.  At the market she sells vegetables.  It is advantageous to buy fruits and vegetables in the autumn.  She would like to take out a loan for this purpose and to expand her product selection.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in order to increase turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a farmer in Murang’a, Central Kenya. He is 52 years old, married, and has two adult children. He has been farming for 20 years. His farm produces tea, coffee, and milk, which goes to the local market.

Julius has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will improve his income and reduce his dependence on his children. He says he wants to own six dairy cows. 

Julius says Juhudi has made it easier for farmers to create wealth.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Perice

texts.en:
Perice, 33, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school.

She has a business of selling shoes in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Perice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more shoes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is from the village of Bacolod, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  To make a living, Roger plants and harvests corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 80,000 PHP with his last crop. His wife also manages their hog raising business for additional income.

At this time, Roger wants to avail himself of a loan for PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to supplement his farm business. He hopes that KIVA lenders will continue assisting him in the business so that he can further improve it and support his family with basic necessities.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
From the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Hok, age 47, is a conscientious villager and a lovely mother of three children. Hok and her husband have cooperated well in earning profits to raise their children. 

This couple owns a lake, which is used to grow lotuses and catch fish. After her husband catches fish and collects mature lotuses from the lake, he brings them home to his wife. Then Hok takes them to sell for money through the village. Together, they typically earn a proximately US$ 8.80 per day to provide the family with a better living. 

Hok is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy some fishing materials (machine boat, net, line and hook) and lotus seeds for growing. This loan will help Hok's family increase more profits, which she’ll use to expand her fish selling business.  She wants to buy a motorcycle to transport her fish to sell through the village in the future. Moreover, she wants to save for her children's education and future.

loans.use: buy fishing materials and lotus seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a father of 10 adult children, but two of whom still stay with him as they pursue their post-secondary education. He is age 62 and has been in farming for 30 years, farming being his sole source of income. His farm currently produces tea, milk and French beans for the local market.

Samuel has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the income generated will help improve his family's livelihood. He intends to start dairy breeding business in the future.

Samuel says he will repay the loan and request more, but he laments of unstable market prices.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Otgonbileg

texts.en:
Otgonbileg is 52 years old and lives with her husband, two children and her granddaughter. Her husband is an accountant, her children are college students and her granddaughter stays at home. 

She started her grocery business in 1996 by planting potatoes. Now, she harvests 2,500 kgs. of potatoes each year and she owns a retailing counter in a local market. 

However, her own harvest isn't enough for running a retail business so she buys additional stocks each year. She is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy other kinds of vegetables for her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To buy other kinds of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock groceries and buy a chip fryer.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en: Glenn is 51 years old. He is married with 2 children. Glenn has a store and owns a video karaoke unit for entertainment, where customers pay per song.  He has had this business for 12 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional items to sell in the store and for the maintenance of the karaoke unit. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Glenn hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on his karaoke unit and to buy additional items to sell in the store.

loans.name: Ngomango

texts.en:
Ngomango is a married man with four children, two of whom attend school. One is too young for school and the other one finished school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Ngomango has operated a goat meat selling business for the past ten years. His potential clients are the people at the market. He faces the major challenge of livestock lost or even death sometimes. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 35,000 he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of the short loan processing and acquiring time.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида замужем имеет одну дочь. Муж строитель. 11 лет она занимается торговлей национальных и хлопчатобумажных  тканей. У нее свои постоянные клиенты. Фарида торгует на протяжении многих лет на одной точке. Приближается зима. Следует поменять ассортимент своего товара. Для этого нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ и увеличить свой товар за счет зимних тканей для шитья национальных женских одежд. Фарида надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Farida is married and has one daughter.  Her husband is a construction worker.  She has been involved in selling national and cotton fabrics for 11 years.  She has her own loyal customers.  Farida has been working at the same retail outlet for many years.  Now that the winter is approaching, she wants to replace her merchandise assortment and needs funds for this.  She wants to obtain a loan and increase her goods inventory with winter fabrics for sewing national women's clothing.  Farida hopes to receive your help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for sewing national women's clothing

loans.name: Seba

texts.en: Seba is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. She has a business of selling soda and mango juice in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years. She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more soft drinks for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Saumu has operated a fried fish selling business for the past ten years. Her potential clients are local people at the market. She faces a major challenge with competition from other operators. She dreams of establishing another different type of business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase more fish, a frying pan and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it offers quality and a variety of services.

loans.use: To purchase more fish, a frying pan and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar, 47, is a watchman who lives with his 3 sons and his wife in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife Ulambayar works as a janitress in a public organization. He has been working as a watchman for many years, but still could not earn enough money. Because his monthly income is low, he cannot provide their necessities.  

Therefore, he decided to start his own new business, which will be a taxi service in addition to his current job. He will run his new business on his days off.  If he can start his new business as planned, he will save all the earnings for the future education of his sons. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to covering his new car payment, purchased to start his own taxi business for increasing his earnings.

loans.use: To cover his new car payment for starting his own taxi business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 58 years old. She is married with 5 children. She has a piggery where she raises hogs intended for selling. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy vaccines and food for the maintenance of her hogs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vaccines and food for her hogs.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard and her younger daughter is a college student, while the older one is an accountant. 

Byambasuren started her grocery retailing business in 2009 by renting a counter in a local market. Now, not only does she sell groceries but also food supplements. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy a mass amount of groceries for stock. 

She is a hard working and diligent woman who says, "When my daughter graduates from college, I will open my own grocery shop." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy more vegetables from Bars market. (Editor's note: "Bars" market is where supermarket shipments load and unload.)

loans.use: To buy more vegetables from Bars market

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается скотоводством. Гулом покупает скот и местных рынках и откармливает их в течении определенный период, а затем продает на выгодную цену. Гулом любить свою семью и работает усердно. В настоящее время он имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота, а 4 голов мелко рогатого скота. Гулом хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое жилищное условия. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за ваше внимание и доброты.
texts.en: Gulom is married and is a responsible father of 2 children.  He has been raising livestock for more then 10 years.  Gulom purchases livestock at local markets fattens it over a period of time and then sells it for a profit.  Gulom loves his family and works diligently.  Right now he has 7 heads of cattle and 4 heads of sheep/goats.  Gulom would like to grow his business and improve his living conditions.  With this goal he is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni.  He thanks all of you in advance for your attention and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a resident and a farmer in Murang’a, Central Kenya. She is age 37 and married with 2 children aged 15 and 6 and both schooling. She has been in mixed farming for 10 years running and currently produces tea, coffee and milk for the local market.

Nancy has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says increased milk production will supplement family meals and provide income that will go into paying for her children's education. She remains optimistic, stating that one day she will be able to produce 100 liters of milk from her current production of 8 liters. 

She states that Juhudi Kilimo has made access to loans for farmers simpler, but notes that the fluctuation of milk prices is the farmer's main undoing.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Baatarjargal

texts.en:
Baatarjargal, 21, has been working as a taxi driver since 2009 and has gained much experience from this business field. At first, he used to hire his taxi car for MNT 20,000 a day from a private taxi company. 

He started his career after he had just graduated from secondary school in order to have a life challenge. His job starts at 7am and finishes at 11pm at night on weekdays. Now he lives with his brother and his family in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Recently, he decided to move out to start his own individual life. To do so, he needs a complete ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) with insulation on the walls before this coming cold winter. Therefore, his loan will be used to cover the payment for a new ger for himself.

loans.use: To buy a new ger for starting his own individual life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes, cosmetics and toys

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 32 years old, married, and is a father of two children.  

Imad has been the owner of an agricultural products shop since 2004.   He has sufficient experience and a good reputation in this field.  He is well-known in the surrounding areas.  He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to renovate his shop and add more inventories.  He is aiming to gain more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his farm products shop and add inventories.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children. Raquel is involved in raising cattle intended for sale. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy food and vaccine maintenance. Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and food for the cattle

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Более 20 лет Олимджон занимается купля продажей скота. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он начал свой бизнес с одного коровы, а постепенно расширил данный бизнес. Сегодняшней день у него 2 голов коровы, 3 голов овца и 1 лошадь. Каждый день он встает рано утро и начинает свое работу. Его жена помогает ему в свободное время. Олимджон хочет купить 2 голов коровы и ремонтировать коровнику для улучшения условие своих скот. Для осуществления своих планов он просить помощь от вас.
texts.en: Olimjon has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 20 years.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He started his business with one cow and gradually expanded this business.  Today, he has two heads of cattle, three heads of sheep and one horse.  He gets up early in the morning every day and starts his work.  His wife helps his during her spare time.  Olimjon wants to buy two heads of cattle and make repairs to a cowshed in order to improve conditions for his livestock.  He is asking for help from you in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cattle and repair a cowshed

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en:
Tsetsegee is 53 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is disabled and her two kids from graduated college and are employed. 

Tsetsegee operates grocery trading business. She started her business in 2002 by building a small building in her yard, which is right across the road. Now, she built an even bigger house for her shop and she is very well-experienced in her business. Now that business is going well, Tsetsegee wants to expand her business by selling a broad range of products. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "past few years I have done everything I can to support my family. Now that my kids are employed, I am more concerned about my business." She is requesting 3,200,000 MNT to purchase more products and to increase the product range of her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her shop

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru: Чуманазар примерный семьянин. У него трое детей и двое внуков. Его жена -  предпринимательница. Он вместе с сыном занимается откормом крупного и мелкого рогатого скота.  Он хочет увеличить свой скот и запастись кормом на зиму. Для этих целей ему надо получить займ и продвинуть свое дело намного вперед. Он надеется на получение займа.
texts.en: Jumanazar is an exemplary family man.  He has three children and two grandchildren.  His wife is an entrepreneur.  Together with his son he fattens cows and sheep/goats.  He would like to increase his livestock count and to stock up on feed for the winter.  For these goals he needs to get a loan and to move his business forward significantly.  He hopes that he will receive a loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim is a 56-year-old woman who resides in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has a life partner in her husband who is a fisherman in the  local area. They are blessed with six children, two are already married and live apart. 

Tim has been involved in a fish selling business for many years. She takes fish that are caught by her husband to sell through the village. She wants to expand this business successfully and maximize her profit but it mainly depends on her husband catching fish. Therefore, Tim has requested a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to buy fishing materials such as a machine boat, fishing net, poles, lines and hooks to support her husband’s daily work. She hopes that this loan will help her family establish a better standard of living. With the increase in income, she’ll provide her children better opportunities to join the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: buy a machine boat, fishing net, poles, lines and hooks

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 45 and lives with his family of 7 children, 4 of whom are still schooling. He has been in farming for 20 years and currently employs one farmhand. He produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which are sold to the local market.

Peres has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income generated to pay school fees for his children. He has focus of acquiring three more dairy cows to boost his business. Peres, however, laments the high cost of feeds, especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36-years-old, married with two children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Jane requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to allow her to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. Umazi has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and medical facilities. 

She has operated a large scale farm for the past 20 years. Her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of lack of modern tools for farming. She dreams of being a leading produce farmer.

With the 10,000 KES, Umazi wants to purchase seedlings and hire a tractor for plowing the farm. She decided to join Yehu because of access to loan facilities of low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and hire a tractor for plowing the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema  lives in Uganda. She is single and has seven children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).    

Rehema has a restaurant. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, cassava and rice.    

The main business challenges for Rehema include the ever increasing prices of food stuffs, and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing some of the foodstuffs and to own a fully stocked restaurant.  

Rehema lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, cassava and rice.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 30 years old. She is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Celina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order for more charcoal for sale. She will use her profits from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза молодая предпринимательница. Второй год она занимается бизнесом-торговлей женской и детской одеждой. У нее свой магазин «ШАПАРАК». Несмотря на молодость, она делает большие успехи в предпринимательстве. Она желает получить займ и расширить свой ассортимент товаров, готовясь к зимнему сезону. Она надеется на вашу поддержку в получении займа и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Gulnoza is a young entrepreneur.  This is her second year in business - sale of women's and children's clothing.  She has her own store "SHAPARAK."  Despite her youth she has had a lot of success in entrepreneurship.  She would like to take out a loan and expand her range of products as she prepares for the winter season.  She hopes for your support in receiving a loan and is grateful in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje is a married man with 10 children, eight of whom attend school, while two are too young for school. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Mwahanje has operated a retail shop for the past 24 years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of credit sales when his customers take too long to pay their debts. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for his shop. He decided to join Yehu to acquire loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Bonnie fish for her business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine  is 35 years old. She is married with 1  child.

Geraldine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Geraldine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,  Geraldine  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Joseph Abu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to introduce to you this group of teachers, from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have requested for a loan 10,900,000.00 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf. 

Joseph is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in a place call Gbalahun, in eastern Sierra Leone, 61 year old Joseph has been in the teaching profession for 43 years. He is married and has 10 children – 2 in primary school, 3 in secondary school and 5 grown-ups. Joseph has applied for this loan in order to buy house building materials and to invest the rest in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy house building materials and invest the rest in agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, six of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. Rose has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail. Rose has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, cassava and rice. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Rose include ever increasing prices  of  foodstuffs and  thieves  .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing food stuffs and to own a fully stocked restaurant.   Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like  bunches of bananas, rice, cassava and beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron for his locksmith business.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela has run her hog raising business for two years. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. Her family lives within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. Tarcela wakes up early in the morning to feed her piglets. After feeding her raised hogs, Tarcela will sell vegetables to increase her income. She believes that she can overcome all her difficulties in running her business and provide for the needs of her family. 

Tarcela would like to request for additional capital amounting to P7,000 to buy feed for her piglets. This amount would really a great help most especially in providing the necessary vitamins and feed maintenance of her raised piglets. In this way, she could sell them for a  greater price, allowing her to send her children into a higher level of education. She hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with four school going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Zawadi has operated a retail shop for the past two years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge in her lack of enough capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking oil and cereals for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because it listens to it clients needs.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking oil and cereals for her shop.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children.
Clarita  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Clarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Clarita  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, viúvo e pai de 7 filhos dos quais apenas um frequenta a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu da sua terra natal a procura de melhores condições de vida, trabalha como operador de máquinas na Cometal LDA ha mais de 30 anos e tem um salario de 3.540.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção  da sua casa (chapas,areia, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt,para o inicio da obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e iniciar um negocio, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. He is a widower and the father of seven children, of which only one attends school. He completed 4th grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns. He also supports two nephews who live with him.
He left his homeland in search of better living conditions. He has worked as a machinery operator for Cometal LDA for over 30 years and earns a salary of 3.540mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies for his house (metal sheets, sand, cement, stone, etc.) so that he can keep building. The first loan was for 10.000mt to begin construction.
He intends to request more money in order to finish up his house and start a business. He will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for his house (metal sheets, sand, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: Халим женат имеет двоих детей. Он занимается услугами такси. Выручка помогает содержать семью. Он единственный кормилец в семье. Более 2 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и набрал достаточно опыта.  Он хочет получить хороший прибыль от данного бизнеса. Он хотел бы получить займ для погашения остаточной суммы приобретенного автомобиля для продолжения своего бизнеса. Он заранее благодарить вас всех за вашу понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Halim is married and has two children.  He provides taxi services.  His earning help to support his family.  He is the sole provider for his family.  He has been in this business for over 2 years and has sufficient experience.  He would like to earn good revenues from this business.  He would like to take out a loan to pay off the remaining balance on his car in order to continue his business.  He thanks all of you in advance for your understanding and support.

loans.use: to pay off the remaining balance on his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 39 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She’s married and her husband is a social worker. They have three children who are between 6 and 14 years old, all of whom are in school and live at home. For the past eighteen years she has been selling clothes in the local market. She makes a good profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She hopes to become a larger-scale businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 33 years old. She is married with 4 children.
Victoria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Victoria  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Victoria  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (rice, beans, fish, peanuts, etc.).

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school, while one is too young for school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a coconut selling business for the past six years. Her potential clients are the people at the market and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods to the market. She dreams of being able to sell her products wholesale.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more coconuts and vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it offers good services to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts and vegetables for her new business.

loans.name: Kev's Group

texts.en:
Kev is the leader of this group with three members. She is a 68-year-old single woman who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. 

Kev is a rice cultivator.  She also owns a store and earns a living by selling bananas that are bought from the local area. From this business, she can earn around US$2 daily. 

Kev is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to to purchase mineral fertilizers to spread on her farmlands. With the rest of the funds, she’ll use it to buy additional bananas for selling. In the future,  Kev hopes to run her business smoothly and maximize profit.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for her farm and bananas to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is aged 44 and married with 6 children aged between 20 and 5 years. They are all in school and their family relies on farming and a second-hand clothes selling business for the family upkeep. Jane's farm produces milk, maize, beans, and vegetables.

Jane (pictured above with two donkeys tied to a cart) has requested a loan of 95,000 KES from Juhudi Kilino in order to construct a dairy unit for 30,000 KES, as well as venture into poultry farming by buying poultry birds and constructing a unit for the birds at a combined 65,000 KES. She says the poultry business venture will grow due to good markets for poultry products in the region. She also aspires to own only pedigree breeds for better income.

She reiterates that many farmers face the challenge of accessing finances and water especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To construct dairy and poultry units and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Ivone

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais apenas um ainda frequenta a Escola.Nunca teve oportunidade de estudar devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 35 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos(PROCREDIT) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades nenhumas. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos( óleo, açúcar, feijão, e outros.) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para construir a sua casa, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is a widow and the mother of six children, of which only one still attends school. She never had the opportunity to study for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 35 years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks (PROCREDIT) and has been able to pay them back without any difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (oil, sugar, beans, etc.) in order to increase the volume of her merchandise.
She intends to request more money in order to build her house. She will request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (oil, sugar, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Тохиржон женат имеет на воспитании двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Чтобы содержать семью он предоставляет услуги такси. Недавно купил новую машину. ГСМ в стране подорожало и такси не выгодно. Для этого он хочет получить займ и установить газовое оборудование. Доходы полученные от услуг идут на содержание семьи. Он надеется получить кредит и заранее благодарить вас за ваше понимание.
texts.en: Tohirjon is married and has two children to raise. His wife is a homemaker. He provides taxi services to support his family. He recently bought a new car. POL prices went up in the country and taxi is not profitable anymore. This is why he wants to get a loan to install gas equipment. The profit from the business will go towards supporting his family. He hopes to get the loan and is thanking everyone in advance for your understanding.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle and install gas equipment for the heating system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers and bitter ball (a vegetable) for her business.

loans.name: Alhaji. M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. Like their counterparts in other regions of the country, they have applied for a loan of 11,900,000 leones in order to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, through their school’s bursary, they will then repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

The leader of this group is Alhaji. This 42-year-old was born in Kono. He is married and has two children who are attending primary school. Alhaji has served in the teaching profession for 10 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house and to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, separada e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola. Frequentou as aulas de alfabetização. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta dois sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu Maputo, é negociante ha mais de 22 anos e tem um renndimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu oitavo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete-se a pagar sem nenhuma dificuldade,e no futuro irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku construir dependência para aluguer.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is separated and has a son who still attends school. She attended literacy classes. She lives with her family in a house she owns. She also supports two nephews who live with her.
She has never left Maputo. She has been a businesswoman for over 22 years and earns an income of about 12.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her eighth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase loads of used clothing in order to increase the amount of her merchandise.
She is committed to repaying without any difficulties. In the future she will request more loans from Hluvuku in order to build a room for renting.

loans.use: to purchase loads of used clothing for selling.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old. She is married with 5 children.

Jocelyn  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor, a 29-year-old housewife, started a small business at home selling kitchen items such as cups, plates, trays, etc., two years ago. The reason Noor started her business is to support her family of two kids and her husband, who is an employee at one of the Jordanian companies. Now Noor has applied for this loan to add new types of kitchen items, such as pans, and to include more home products like vases.

loans.use: to add new types of kitchen items, such as pans, and include more home products like vases.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 400 heads of cabbages and 5 crates of tomatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Emin

texts.ru:
Эмин /Emin/ родился в 1959г. в селе Хдранц/Khdrants/, там же он и окончил Агаракскую  сельскую среднюю школу, затем поступил и окончил Капанское Профтехучилище. Эмин  по специальности токарь. Эмин женат имеет сына и двух дочерей. Сын женат и живет отдельно от родителей. Дочки тоже замужем и каждая живет отдельно от родителей ,вместе со своими семьями. Жена Эмина очень помогает мужу по хозяйству. Эмин работает  лесником  в Капанском лесхозе. Кроме работы по специальности с 1994 года Эмин также занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью в селе Хдранц. Имеет крупный рогатый скот, кур, свиней, пчел и огород на котором выращивает овощи. Эмин имеет также собственный земельный участок, где Эмин усердно выращивает  пшеницу. У него есть постоянные клиенты в г. Капане, которые покупают  выращенные им овощи, а также говядину, свинину, мед, яйца, молоко. Так как зарплата лесника маленькая, то выручка  от продажи сельскохозяйственных продуктов очень помогает Эмину содержать как свою семью, так и  помагать семьям своих  детей . 
Эмину нужен кредит 600.000 драм для посевных работ (покупки нового сорта зерна, дизельного топлива), которые намного улучшат производительность сельскохозяйственных продуктов.
texts.en:
Emin was born in 1959 in Khdrants village, there he graduated from Agarak village high school and then enrolled in and graduated from Kapan Vocational School.  Emin is a lathe operator by profession.  Emin is married and has a son and two daughters.  The son is married and lives separately from the parents.  The daughters are also married and each lives separately from the parents with her family.  Emin's wife helps him a lot with managing the household.  Emin works as a forester in the Kapan forest.  

In addition to working in his profession Emin has also been working in agriculture since 1994 in Khdrants village.  He owns livestock, chickens, pigs, bees and a garden where he grows vegetables.  Emin also has a plot of land where he diligently grows wheat.  He has regular customers in Kapan city who purchase vegetables that he grows as well as beef, pork, honey, eggs and milk.  Since a forester's salary is low the earnings from the sale of agricultural products help Emin to support his family and also to help the families of his children. Emin needs a loan of 600,000 dram for planting (purchase a new variety of grain, diesel fuel), which will significantly improve the performance of his agricultural products.

loans.use: To plant (purchase a new variety of grain, diesel fuel)

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has been engaged in a fish selling business for one year.  She is able to earn about PHP 3,500 a month. She works hard to provide for the needs of her family because she stands as both father and mother to her five children. 

Through her fish selling business, Imelda is able to sustain her children's daily needs but as they grow up her expenses also increase.  So, she needs to increase her profit by increasing the fish she sells. For this reason, Imelda is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy more kinds of fish for her fish selling business. She hopes that she can maintain her business and have greater income to sustain her family's needs and improve their living condition. One thing she hopes for is to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mbana

texts.fr: Madame Mbana est âgée  de 48 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de plus de 5 enfants. Elle évolue depuis 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément dans la vente d’encens, de tissus (wax et voile). Elle fait aussi de la broderie. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 9 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus à revendre a l’occasion de la fête de la Tabaski. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de ses revenus et de soutenir ses enfants qui étudie dans les dépenses de frais de scolarité.
texts.en: Mbana is 48 years old and lives in Senegal. She is married and has more than 5 children. She has been working as a retailer for ten years, more specifically selling incense and fabrics (wax-print and voile). She also does embroidery. Mbana has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since May 2003. She has already repaid nine previous loans. She is requesting this loan for 150,000 francs to buy fabrics to re-sell for the Tabaski holiday (Eid al-Adha). This loan will allow her to improve her income and support her children, who are in school, by paying their school fees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to re-sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ayida

texts.ru:
Айида родилась в пгт. Мин-Куш  (Жумгалский район, Нарынская область, Кыргызская республика). Не замужем и воспитывает четверых детей.
Айида родилась в простой семье фермера. Когда Айиде было 6 лет, ее родители решили переехать в село Сосновку (Жайылский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызская республика), где устроились в местной ткацкой фабрике, она в качестве рабочей, а он в качестве водителя. В Сосновке Айида и закончила школу. После окончания школы Айида поступила в Политехнический институт в городе Бишкек (столица Кыргызстана) по специальности ткачиха.
В 1994 году в возрасте 20 лет, учась на третьем курсе, Айида вышла замуж. Учебу пришлось бросить и посвятить время семье. Ее муж работал в колхозе села Сосновка и после свадьбы колхоз, в котором он работал, выдал им участок земли под строительство дома. Айида устроилась на работу в Ковровый Комбинат, находящийся в городе Карабалта, а муж занимался полеводством и животноводством. В 1997 году Айида родила дочь, в 1999 и в 2000 году родила двух сыновей, и в 2003 году еще одну прелестную девочку. Они продолжали работать- она в комбинате, а он по хозяйству. Дома содержали небольшое хозяйство. 
В 2006 году от Айиды ушел муж. Она стойко пережила это время – ей пришлось оставить работу на комбинате и полностью посвятить свое время детям и домашнему хозяйству. 
В данное время, благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Айиды, в хозяйстве у нее имеется 2 дойных коровы, 3 телки и 7 голов баранов, а также она ежегодно арендует несколько гектаров орошаемой земли, на которой выращивает картофель и другие овощи. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Айида обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения количества скота. 
Со временем, Айида мечтает расширить площадь сарая и увеличить поголовье скота. А на свободные деньги мечтает купить благоустроенную квартиру в городе Карабалта.
texts.en:
Aiyda was born in the village of Min-Kush, in the Jumgalskiy region of Narynskaya province, Republic of Kyrgyzstan. She is not married and is raising four children. Ayida was born in a simple family of a farmer. When Ayida was six years old her parents decided to move to the village of Sosnovka in the Jayilskiy region, Chuyskaya province, Republic of Kyrgyzstan, where they got a job at the local weaving factory, her mother as a worker and her father as a driver. Ayida finished school in Sosnovka. After graduation Ayida enrolled in the polytechnic institute in the city of Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) majoring in weaving.

In 1994 when she was twenty years old in her third year in college Ayida got married. She had to leave school to devote her time to family. Her husband worked in the collective farm of the village of Sosnovka and after their wedding the collective farm where he worked had given them a land parcel to build a house. Ayida found a job in the Carpet factory which was in the town of Karabalta, and her husband was doing agriculture and animal husbandry. In 1997 Ayida gave birth to a daughter, then in 1999 and 2000 she had two sons and in 2003 she had another lovely daughter. They continued working, she at the factory and he was taking care of the business. They had a home based business.

In 2006 Ayida's husband left her. She was steadfast and survived through this time. She had to leave her job at the factory to completely devote herself to the children and their business.

At this time thanks to her persistence and diligence Ayida has two milk cows, three heifers and seven heads of sheep, as well as several hectares of land which she rents our annually where she grows potatoes and other vegetables. For further growth of her business Ayida came to Bai Tushum and Partners for the loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to increase the amount of cattle.

In time Ayida dreams to expand the area of the shed and increase the headcount of the cattle. She also dreams to buy a good apartment in the town of Karabalta using the proceeds from the business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Орифчон молодой энергичный предприниматель. Он женат. Жена домохозяйка. Ранее он занимался торговлей обуви и вот уже три года как занимается торговлей  тканей для женской одежды. Орифчон содержит свою семью и хочет расширить обороты своего товара. Он желает получить займ  и добиться еще успехов  в своем предпринимательском деле.
texts.en: Orifjon is a young and energetic businessman. He is married. His wife is a homemaker. Earlier he used to sell shoes and as of three years ago he sells fabrics for women's clothing. Orifjon supports his family and wants to increase the turnover of his inventory. He wants to get a loan and achieve even more success in this business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics with the purpose of renewing the inventory.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. Более 8 лет он занимается выращиванием селхоз культур. Он имеет 10 гектар земли и там выращивает лук, пшеница и фасоль. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Данное время он имеет 10 голов крупного рогатого скота. Камолиддин планирует купить минеральных удобрений, ГСМ и семена лука для посева. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США. Он заранее благодарить вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Kamoliddin is married and is a loving father of three children. He is smart and purposeful man. He has been growing agriculture crops for more than eight years. He has ten hectares of land where he grows onions, wheat and beans. He also does animal husbandry. At this time he has ten heads of large horned cattle. Kamoliddin plans to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel and onion seeds for sowing. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $3,000 USD for this purpose. He is thankful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, onion seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 60-year-old married man. He has 5 children between the ages of 6 and 24 years. He describes himself as God-fearing, hard-working, trustworthy, and patient. He operates a charcoal-sales business where he sells charcoal to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a busy shopping centre. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as the low purchasing power of his customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase his stock of charcoal. His business goal is to grow his current business and diversify into a fish-selling business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To increase his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children.

Gerlyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gerlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gerlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials and fish for resale

loans.name: Isata's Group

texts.en:
In the photo are teachers in one of the schools in Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan. Like their counterparts in other regions of the country, they have requested this loan for varied reasons – some to pay school fees for their children, buy house-building materials, invest in business, etc. At the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva lenders, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repaying SMT/Kiva lenders. 

Isatu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 42-year-old was born in a place called Koayima, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with 6 children – 1 in primary school and 5 in secondary school. Isatu has been a professional teacher for 10 years. She has requested this loan to pay school fees for her children and to invest the rest of the loan in a business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and invest the rest of the loan in a business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 44-year-old married man. He has 4 children ranging in age from 4 to 20 years old. He describes himself as efficient. 

He operates a tailoring services business where he makes suits. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in a busy shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his stock of materials. His business goal is to grow his business and open other branches within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he can buy a plot of land on which he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Thelma has a piggery and is involved in hog raising. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy food supplies and vaccines for hogs that are being raised to sell.

Thelma joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy vaccines and food supplies for hogs that are being raised to sell

loans.name: Makhburat

texts.ru: Махбурат замужем. Её муж парикмахер. На воспитание имеют двоих детей. Для содержания семьи она начала занимается торговлей детской одежды. И вот на протяжении 15 лет помогает мужу в содержании семьи данным видом бизнесом. К предстоящей холодной погоде ей нужно обновить товар. Для этого она хочет получить займ и пополнить ассортимент продаваемых одежд.
texts.en: Makhburat is married. Her husband is a barber. They are raising two children. She started to sell children's clothing to support the family. During the past fifteen years she helps her husband in supporting the family by doing this business. She needs to renew her inventory for the upcoming cold weather. Makhburat wants to get a loan to renew the variety of the clothing she sells.

loans.use: to buy clothing with the purpose of renewing the inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, six of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). Rose has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. Rose sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Rose has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Rose include the ever-increasing price of charcoal and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for charcoal and to sell at wholesale only.  Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion has been engaged in mixed farming for 10 years, selling his produce of milk and tea at the local market. He and his wife live in Litein Soth Rift, Kenya, with their four children, whose ages range between five and 15. Simion also runs a retail shop for additional income.

Simion has made a loan request of 90,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase two dairy cows. This is his second loan after his first one of 50,000 KES, which he promptly repaid. He is confident that the loan will boost his farming income and enable him to meet his family's needs.

He cites the high cost of dairy feeds as his primary challenge. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in the Paynesville area. She is married and her husband is a business man. For the past four years she has been selling chains and body spray in the local market. She make lots of profit that helps her to pay her house rent.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chains and body spray for her business. In the future she hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more chains and body spray for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 30-year-old single man who describes himself as honest. He operates a charcoal sales business where he sells charcoal to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. The business is located within a residential area. James describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds.

James will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his stock of charcoal. His business goal is to grow his business to wholesale within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a family of his own.

loans.use: to increase his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est âgée  de 65 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de famille.  Elle s’active dans le commerce de glace et de jus locaux. Elle est sociétaire de l’un  des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2000. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour la reconstruction  du mur qui la sépare de son voisin. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou, age 65, lives in Senegal. She's married and a mother. She sells ice and local fruit juices.

She's been a member of the local UIMCEC branch since April 2000. She's seeking a loan of XOF 150'000, in order to rebuild a wall between her and her neighbor.

This loan will enable her to improve the living environment of her family.

loans.use: to rebuild a separation wall

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice runs a food stall business in Kampala, Uganda. She has been in this business for two years, and she works six days out of every week. Eunice sells her products on a retail basis from her home. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She also takes care of her sister.

Eunice has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy more tomatoes, onions, bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Eunice include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis and to start sales in neighboring villages.   

Eunice lives in a home that she owns: the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her primary monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, onions, bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been engaged in farming for eight years. His farm produces tea and milk, which he sells to the local market. He and his wife live in Litein with their three children, whose ages range between two and eight years old. For additional income, David also runs a motorcycle transport business.
