David has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He feels that the markets should be developed further to avoid common fluctuation in prices, but he is optimistic about his dairy business, saying his production could possibly double in five years, allowing him to uplift his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Munavvara

texts.ru: Мунаввара замужем имеет двоих детей. Дети взрослые. Муж предприниматель. На рынке  на протяжении 8 лет она торгует детской одеждой и детской обувью. Детская одежда востребована всегда. Для расширения ассортимента зимних товаров она хочет получить займ. Доходы от своего бизнеса она тратит на семью и на обучение детей. Она надеется на то, что этот займ поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и прибыльность ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Munavvara is married and has two children, both of whom are adults.  Her husband is an entrepreneur.  Munavvara has been selling children's clothing and shoes at the market for 8 years.  Children's clothing is always in demand.  She wants to obtain a loan in order to expand the assortment of winter merchandise.  Munavvara spends her business profit on the family and children's education.  She hopes that this loan will help her increase goods turnover and business profit.

loans.use: to purchase winter seasonal clothing

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en:
Rosetta, age 36, sells coconuts at the local market to earn a living. She and her husband live in the Paynesville area with their four children, whose ages range between five and 14 years old. All four are enrolled in school and live at home. Rosetta's husband works as a driver.

Rosetta has been engaged in her business for the past five years. She makes a good profit from her work, which helps her to pay her children's school fees.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more coconuts for her business. She hopes eventually to build a house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse, age 30, describes himself as honest and visionary. He operates a bakery where he sells cakes, doughnuts, and other baked goods to the local people. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

Jesse and his wife have a three-and-a-half-year-old child.

Jesse intends to use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy flour and cooking oil. His goal is to grow his business into a larger bakery within five years. He is hopeful that he will eventually be able to provide a good education for his children. He also aspires toward buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy flour and cooking oil for his bakery business

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth, age 38, is a farmer. He has been engaged in farming for 14 years and sells his produce of tea, onions, cabbages, and milk to the local market. He and his wife have three children, all enrolled in school. 
 
Kenneth has made a first-time loan request in the amount of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy a dairy cow. He is confident that this will help the family meet its basic needs and eventually to build on their wealth by buying land. Insufficient land ownership is often a great limitation to many local farmers.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for providing training to farmers so that they gain essential farming knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Musavvar

texts.ru: Мусаввар замужем имеет четверых детей. Она имеет свою лавку по торговле продовольственных товаров. В бизнесе ей помогает дочь. Продовольственные товары следует пополнять ежедневно и в большом количестве. Для этого она хочет получить займ и расширить обороты своего бизнеса. Она очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Musavvar is married and has four children.  She has her own store, where she sells grocery products.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Grocery products inventory has to be refilled daily and in large quantities.  Musavvar wants to obtain this loan for this purpose and increase product turnover in her business.  She very much hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia owns and operates a business selling soft drinks in her local community. She is unmarried and lives in the Paynesville area with her 11-year-old child, who is enrolled in school and lives at home.

Emilia has been engaged in her business for the past 10 years. She makes a good profit, which helps her to pay her child's school fees.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks to offer for sale. Her plan is to build a house and to continue to be able to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a larger stock of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou  habite dans une des localités du territoire  sénégalais. Elle est âgée  de 49 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et exerce depuis plus de 35 ans la vente de poissons.  C’est sous l’influence de sa maman qu’elle a opté pour cette activité depuis le bas âge.  Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2005. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour l’achat de poissons, produit  qui devient de plus en plus cher sur le marché. Ce financement lui permettra de maintenir le niveau de son activité. C’est pour lui un moyen d’augmenter son fond de roulement afin de pouvoir  continuer a répondre a la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Aissatou lives in a town in Senegal. She is 49 years old. She has developed a business selling fish, which she has been doing for more than 35 years. Her choice to follow this line of business was influenced by her mother. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since August 2005, and is now requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to buy fish, a product which is becoming more and more expensive on the market. This loan will allow her to maintain her business volume and it is a means of increasing her working capital so that she can continue to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Asylbek

texts.ru:
Асылбек  40-летний фермер, живущий в с .Талды-Суу (северо-восточная часть Кыргызстана). С 1992 года семья Асылбека успешно занимается разведением скота и перепродажей сельхоз продукции. Особое внимание  он уделяет культивированию и выращиванию особого сорта картофеля, пользующийся  повышенным спросом у местного населения. Упорный и неустанный труд в бизнесе позволяет Асылбеку покрывать расходы своей семьи и поддерживать своих престарелых родителей и их хозяйство.   
Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Асылбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Асылбек намерен использовать для реконструкции сарая  в целях обеспечения хороших условия для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Asylbek is a 40 year old farmer who lives in Taldy-Suu village (north-east part of Kyrgyzstan).  Since 1992 Asylbek's family has been successfully growing livestock and reselling agricultural produce.  He pays special attention to cultivating and growing a specific type of potato, that has had an increase in demand from the local population.  Stubborn and hard work on his business allows Asylbek to pay for his family's expenses and to support his elderly parents and their household.  

In order to continue to increase his livestock headcount Asylbek turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) in order to purchase additional livestock for fattening.  Asylbek plans to use the expected profits to rebuild his shed in order to provide good conditions for raising livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Yamh

texts.en:
Yamh is 37 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is married to a social worker.  Yamh and her husband have three children ages 4 to 13, who attend school and live at home. 

For the past five years she has been selling charcoal in her community. The profit helps her pay her children's school fees and buy school supplies. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  In the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Monicah Njeri

texts.en:
Monicah is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children aged 1 to 11 years. She describes herself as focused. 

Monicah operates a farming business where she sells farm produce, including maize, green vegetables and milk. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a rural area known as Kimende. She describes her biggest business challenge as financial constraints. 

Monicah will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to grow her business and deliver more milk to a dairy factory within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a vehicle to facilitate transportation while running her businesses.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is aged 21 and  married though not yet blessed with any child. He has been in farming in Kitale for the last 4 years producing and selling milk, maize and eggs to the local market. He runs a motorcycle transport business besides farming.

David  has requested for a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.He says the dairy cow purchase will provide milk for the family consumption and improve the family living standards. He says he will buy more dairy cows for better business.

He however states dairy animal diseases are limiting farmers income significantly.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth Gathoni

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children aged six and eight. She describes herself as focused. 

Elizabeth operates a a general store where she sells soft drinks, mineral water, clothes and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center. Her biggest business challenge is that the area is very cold, which affects the intake of water and juices. 

Elizabeth will use the Kes 50,000 loan to increase her stock of drinks. Her business goal is to grow the business to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big supermarket in the area.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adelle

texts.en:
Adelle is 42 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is married to a social worker.  Adelle and her husband have five children between the ages of 16 and 24; they are in school and live at home. 

For the past twelve years Adelle has been involved in a soap-making business. She makes a good profit and has increased her customer base. 

Adelle is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies for her business.  In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 23, is a farmer. He has carried out his farming efforts for the past year in his home area in Muranga, producing horticultural products for the local market. He also works as a barber at the market.

James has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy a motorcycle and venture into the transport business. He says that he has resolved to undertake this effort since the market is currently experiencing a boom. The cost of motorcycles has come down drastically after the government’s intervention to help the transport sector. He adds that this will supplement his farming income and allow him to build a strong foundation for his future family.

He says the primary challenge for farmers remains access to financing, a challenge that Juhudi Kilimo is mitigating through its loans.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and venture into the transport business

loans.name: Tabitha Wanjiru

texts.en:
Tabitha, age 30, describes herself as determined and focused. She operates a furniture-making business where she sells such items as tables, beds, couches, wall units, and wooden doors. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a rural area. 

She and her husband have three children, whose ages range from five months to six years.

Tabitha describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber, nails, and wood furnish. Her business goal is to improve the quality of her end products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will become a dealer and a renowned businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails, and wood furnish

loans.name: Elkie

texts.en:
Elkie, age 36, has operated a restaurant for the past 25 years. She makes a good profit and has many customers, since she runs the only business selling delicious traditional food in her community. She is unmarried and lives in the Paynesville area. Her two children, ages 10 and 14, live in the U.S., where they attend school.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, rice, oil, pepper, coal, and onions for her business. She hopes to become an international businesswoman and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, rice, oil, pepper, coal, and onions for her restaurant business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, age 26, has been engaged in an agricultural business, specifically animal breeding, for about six years. He lives in Ddmashen village in the Sevan area with his parents, his brother, and his sister. All the members of Edgar's family help him with his business. The family owns their own plot of land, where Edgar breeds cows, pigs, chickens, and lambs. The milk is used for family needs, but the meat is sold to local meat dealers. 

Edgar is a graduate of Sevan Industry Technical School, where he specialized in the area of road transport. Edgar’s father works as a dyer. His mother maintains the home but does not otherwise work. His sister has graduated from medical college but is as yet unemployed. His brother has recently returned from the army and is also unemployed for the moment.

Edgar has decided to add to his number of animals. This addition will help him to grow his farming business. He has requested a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a cow and purchase pig fodder. Adding a cow will help develop the business and add to the family's milk production. 

Edgar is a second-level client in Nor Horizon and has never been delayed in his loan repayments.

Edgar is a very hard-working person and he likes his farming business very much. Thanks to his farming income, Edgar helps to support the family and is committed to improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow and purchase pig fodder

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino lives in the village of Sartichala, Gardabani District, East Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her three sons who are 20, 18 and 14 years old. Her youngest son goes to school and the elder ones work in the Ministry of Defense for the country. They get salaries, which are important sources of income for the family. 

Tsitsino has a milk cow. She produces cheese and sells on average 20 kg of it locally to dairy-product retailers. Now she requested credit to purchase a second milk cow. She will double the amount of produced and sold cheese and thus increase her income by 100%. She will use her increased income for purchasing new household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Onester

texts.en:
Onester is 35 years old.  She is a married woman with three children, and all three are in the school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Onester requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 28 years old, married and has a five-year-old child.  To earn a living, he operates a motorbike transport business.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed two people.  Additionally, he runs a retail shop to supplement his income.  He has been able to improve his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

Dennis' desire is to expand his business in five years.  He has requested 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Susan Waithira

texts.en:
Susan is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 11 to 17 years. She describes herself as determined.

She operates a farming business where she sells vegetables and milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a rural area known as Kinale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be getting cheap animal feed.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to start zero-grazing (stall feeding) her cattle within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will become a leading milk supplier in the area.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 40 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is married and has five children between 13 and 24 years old. All of them are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, she has been operating a shop in her community. She makes a lot of profit that helps her to send her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tissue, toothpaste, milk and soap for her business. She hopes to build a house and support her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase more tissue, toothpaste, milk and soap for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rayisomzita Group

texts.fr:
Mme Madina est la représentante du groupe RAYISOMZITA. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 17mois. Deux(02) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend du sucre et du sel depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au marché. Ses clients sont celles qui vendent les jus, les galettes et la bouillie.

Elle veut s’acheter 06 sacs de sucre de 50kilogrammes, 03sacs de sel.

Mme avec ses économies aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Elle ambitionne son activité en ouvrant une boutique pour ses produits et être une grossiste plus tard.
texts.en:
Madina is the representative of the RAYISOMZITA group.  She is married and has three children.  Her eldest is 11 years old and her youngest is 17 months old.  Two of her children attend school.  She is responsible for one other person.

Madina has been selling sugar and salt for 13 years.  She stocks up at the wholesalers in the market.  Her customers are people who sell juice, cookies and baby cereal.

Madina would like to buy six 50kg sacks of sugar and three sacks of salt.

Madina will use her savings to help her husband with their family expenses.  She plans to open a store from which to sell her products and to later become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy six 50kg sacks of sugar and three sacks of salt

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has had 5 years in a farming business in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya, where he also lives. He is 26 and single. His farm produces maize, beans and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Charles has requested a loan of 41,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 25,000 KES and poultry birds at 15,000 KES. He says he aspires to have at least five dairy cows and make his dairy farming more commercial. He had previously acquired a loan of a similar amount and says it has improved his family life.

He says shortage of animal feed is the main challenge, but he is glad to have access to Juhudi Kilimo loans.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and poultry birds

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal, a talented 45-year-old housewife, makes artificial flowers from plastic and other material to sell. (Since Feryal is a conservative person, her son, Mahmoud, has agreed to appear in the photo.) Her business is based at home, and it has been running for a while. Her son, Mahmoud, 24 years old, helps her sell her products mostly to decoration and florist shops.

Feryal now has applied for this loan to buy more materials so she can make a larger quantity of items and spread out to include more point of sale shops.

loans.use: to buy more materials so she can make a larger quantity of artificial flowers and plants

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais dois ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 2ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ningem. 

É criadora de frangos dedica-se ao agro-negocio ha mais de 1 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em grupo na Helvetas de Moçambique,no montante de 2.000.00mt, para investir no negocio e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu décimo TERCEIRO emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende aplicar no seu agro-negocio para aumentar o nível de productividade. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 1.500.00mt, 2.000.00mt, 3.000.00mt, 4.610.00mt, 5.501.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 8.365.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 12.254.00mt, 19.733.00mt, e 23.058.00mt, para a mesma actividade.

No futuro sonha em iniciar o seu proprio negocio, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, two of which still attend school. She completed second grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
She raises poultry. She has been in the agricultural business for over one year and earns an income of about 3.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had group loans with Helvetas in Mozambique, in the amount of 2.000mt. She used it to invest in her business and she was able to pay it back without difficulties.
She first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her 13th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use for her agricultural business in order to increase the level of productivity. The first loans were for 1.500mt, 2.000mt, 3.000mt, 4.610mt, 5.501mt, 6.000mt, 6.000mt, 8.365mt, 12.000mt, 12.254mt, 19.733mt and 23.058mt, for the same purpose.
In the future she dreams of starting her own business. She will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and to prepare the land for producing vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (stone, sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Adijah

texts.en:
Adijah is a mother of four children and three of which are already in school.  She has been in farming for seven years producing vegetables, beans, maize, and eggs which are sold to the local market.

Adijah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a bigger and better poultry unit for her growing number of birds.  She says poultry diseases are a great challenge and good housing will ensure the birds health and improve the business income, thereby making life better.  This is her sixth subsequent loan with Juhudi and she reiterates that the loans have changed her life and that of her entire family.

Adijah notes diseases and drought as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Hyam

texts.en:
Hyam, 36 years old, is married with three daughters and one son. She has always loved make-up and beauty stuff; her relatives have gone to her whenever there is an occasion to prepare their make-up. Two years ago she started getting paid for her work, as she turned her hobby into a small business at home. During this period she was able to add another service, selling beauty products, that attracted more women to be customers.

Now Hyam has applied for this loan to help her increase her profit by developing her home-based beauty salon and buying more cosmetics, so she can open her own separate beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Weyeta Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weyeta Group in Western Kenya! Joan is the facilitator of the Weyeta SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joan takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wilberforce and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. In 2012, the members of Weyeta SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With income from maize sales, Joan will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In the photo, Joan is pictured with his group and on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Sonunbubu

texts.ru: Сонунбубу – 51 год, вдова и имеет четырех детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1989 году Сонунбубу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Сонунбубу смогла развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 2 коровы, 10 овец, 10 коз и 2 лошади и приносящее ежемесячно около 5,000 сом. Прибыль Сонунбубу вложила в высшее образование для своих детей, сумев дать возможность приобрести профессию преподавателя английского языка и юриста для своих дочерей,  и военного офицера  - для сына. Ее младший сын Уланбек решил остаться с матерью и помогать ей по хозяйству, так как после смерти мужа Сонунбубу ее престарелая свекровь осталась жить вместе с этой семьей.    В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Сонунбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 133,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота в будущем.
texts.en: Sonunbubu is 51 years old, a widow and has four children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Sonunbubu started her own animal husbandry business in 1989.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Sonunbubu was able to develop her business to contain two cows, ten sheep, ten goats and two horses today and yielding about 5,000 som per month.  Sonunbubu invested the profit into the higher education for her children, enabling her daughters to become and English language teacher and a lawyer and her son to become a military officer.  Her youngest son, Ulanbek, decided to stay with his mother and help her with the business because Sonunbubu's elderly mother-in-law decided to continue living with her family after Sonunbubu's husband's death.  In order to further expand her business, Sonunbubu requested a loan in the sum of 133,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls for fattening up and resale.  She plans to use the profit from this loan to increase livestock quantity in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onion for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina is 27 years old and a married woman with four children and two are in school.  She is a tailor in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.  Celina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to purchase more rolls of fabric.  She will use her profits to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more rolls of fabric for sale.

loans.name: Amani B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amani B Group in Western Kenya! Erastus is the facilitator of this group. They joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Erastus takes care of eight children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Erastus had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Erastus was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Erastus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. In 2012, the members of Amani B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With income from maize sales, Erastus will pay for large expenditures such as school fees and buying young livestock. He is pictured with his group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Hellen Kasivi

texts.en: Hellen is a 41 year-old married woman. She has 4 children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 25 years. She describes herself as being talkative and likes sharing ideas. She operates a clinic where she provides medical services to patients and sells medicine to them. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes10,000 loan to buy more medicine. Her business goal is to grow her business and open another clinic in a different area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the university level

loans.use: To purchase medicine

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en:
Concepter is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 28 and married, with 2 children between the ages of  6 and 2.  She has 5 years experience in farming and currently employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces milk, maize and beans for the local markets.
 
Concepter has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and expand her dairy farm business.This is her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo.  She aspires to have five dairy cows and give her family better living standards.

She sees high costs of animal diseases during dry seasons as the major challenge

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline lives in Barnersville.   She is single and has four children between 18 and 27 years old.  They are currently in school and live at home.  For the past four years, she has been selling used shoes, body cream, bath soap, and roll-ons in the local market.  She makes a good profit and has more customers and fewer goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, bath soap, roll-ons and used shoes for her business.  She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, bath soap, roll-on, and used shoes for her business

loans.name: Jua Kali Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jua Kali Group in Western Kenya! Ridah is the facilitator of the Jua Kali group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ridah is the mother of eight children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and provide education for them. In the recent 2011 season, Ridah had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ridah was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ridah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. In 2012, the members of Jua Kali group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With income from maize sales, Ridah will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 41, describes himself as God-fearing and honest. He operates a cereals sales business, selling such items as maize, beans, and green beans. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a shopping center in Mombasa. He describes his biggest business challenges to be competition and the seasonality of certain cereals. 

David and his wife have four children between the ages of four and 12.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add to his stock of beans. His business goal is to grow his business into a wholesale endeavor within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to build a big residential house for his family.

loans.use: to add to his stock of beans

loans.name: Maji Safi Group

texts.en: Greetings from Maji Safi group in Western Kenya! Christine is the facilitator of the Maji Safi group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Christine takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate her children and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Christine had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Christine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. In 2012, the members of Maji Safi group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. With income from maize sales, Christine will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. She is joined by her group members in the photograph with their Field Officer in blue.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Marrion's Group

texts.en:
Marrion's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Marrion is 16 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Marrion has been working hard to manage her pharmacy, which provides medicine and basic treatments to local patients. 

To help expand her business, Marrion has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicines to sell in her shop, and will help Marrion to generate greater profits and pay her brother's school fees. Marrion hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Marrion is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Marrion's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money and manage her finances.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines to offer through her pharmacy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood blocks for building

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron, age 52, has been engaged in farming for 13 years. He lives with his wife and four children, who are between five and 14 years old. The family lives in Litein South Rift, Kenya. 

Aron's farm produces milk, eggs, and tea, all of which he sells to the local market. His primary business challenge is the poor local market prices for farm produce.

Aron has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy more birds for his poultry business. He is confident that this boost will improve his income, provide for food and essentials for the family, and uplift the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more birds for his poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more socks and sacking for her business

loans.name: Dennis Sammy

texts.en:
Dennis, age 26 and unmarried, describes himself as God-fearing and obedient. He operates a pub where he sells soft drinks, wines, and spirits. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to increase his stock of sodas. His business goal is to relocate his business to the town center within five years. He hopes in the future to diversify his business into a general store and open a soft drinks depot.

loans.use: to increase his stock of sodas

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 25, runs a second-hand clothes business in Yei in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. Mary and her husband have two children, one of whom is enrolled in school.

Mary has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to enable her to purchase more clothes to offer for sale. She intends to save the profits from this loan toward her goal of building a house for her family in future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 26 years old and married.  He sells electronic goods to earn a living.  He has employed two people to assist him in his tasks.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business.  He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination.  Joel has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy radios, remote controls, battery chargers and mobile phones

loans.use: To buy radios, remote controls, battery chargers and mobile phones

loans.name: Sokhna Elisabeth

texts.fr: Madame Sokhna est une veuve de 47 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis 2 ans dans le commerce de thioups et autres tissus divers.  La raison fondamentale du choix de son activité est  la volonté d’avoir une activité génératrice de revenus  qui lui permette de subvenir personnellement à ses besoins. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2007. elle a déjà remboursé 4 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 fr prévu pour l’achat d’autres marchandises diverses en vue des préparatifs de la fête  de Tabaski. Son intention est de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhna is a 47-year-old widow who lives in Senegal. She has been selling thioups and other fabrics for two years. The main reason for her choosing this particular occupation was the desire to have an income-generating activity that would allow her to support herself. 

She became a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches in August 2007. She has already obtained and repaid four previous loans. She is now seeking a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase various items in preparation for the Tabaski celebration. Her goal is to diversify her stock and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Susannah

texts.en:
Susannah, age 53, is a breadmaker. She has been engaged in this business for the past ten years. She is well-known in her community and makes a good profit from making and selling her bread. 

She is divorced and has three grown children in their thirties. They are attending college and living at home. Susannah herself is a high-school graduate.

At present, she does not have sufficient baking supplies in stock, so she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, and butter. 

Her eventual goal is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, and butter

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 47, is a farmer in Muranga, Cental Kenya. She has been engaged in farming for 10 years, producing milk and selling it to the local market. She lives with her three children, ages nine, 11, and 14.

Mary has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to pay for a water tank. She tells us that scarcity of water has been the farm's main challenge, greatly reducing its output, and she is confident that her income will improve with the aquisition of the water tank. She anticipates improving the living standards of her family in this way.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Brenda's Group

texts.en:
Brenda's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Brenda is 16 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Brenda has been working hard with her mother to manage her bar, which sells drinks and snacks to local customers. 

To help expand her family's business, Brenda has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more crates of beer, and will help Brenda's family to generate greater profits and contribute to her family's needs. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land to build on. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Brenda's future prospects by helping her to become assertive, know herself as a woman, become a good member of the community.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 21-year-old artistic young lady, who inherited her talent from her mother, Fathiya. Since she was young, Walaa has had a hobby of playing and shaping stuff using clay and gypsum. Having artistic talent and learning more about it from her experienced mother has given her the courage to start a small business at a young age, making decorative items using clay and gypsum. She also added drawing on glass to what she does.

At this point Walaa is selling what she makes to decoration shops, hoping that one day she will have her own workshop with her mother and have their own store selling these items.

In order to do that, Walaa has applied for this loan to buy more materials and paints to make more and more products so she can have the required amount of money to get a store.

Since Walaa is a conservative person, her mother Fathiya has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy new materials and paints to make her gypsum crafts.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, she uses her van to offer transport.  Previously, she used to sell handbags and fabric. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and manage her business.  This is because she has been trained on business management skills.

Alice hopes to own more vehicles for her transport business.  She needs 100,000 Kenya shillings to service her van.

loans.use: To service her van

loans.name: Mbekh

texts.fr: Madame Mbekh est âgée  de 55 ans. C’est une veuve qui s’active depuis un an dans le commerce et la vente de petit déjeuner et diner. Elle a choisi son activité par opportunité et a profité de l’ouverture d’une nouvelle boulangerie dans la localité ou elle habite pour s’installer à ses abords et développer son activité. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 7 prêts  antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat et la mise en place d’un stock de denrées afin de pouvoir dégager une marge bénéficiaire plus intéressante. En    même temps elle veut  lutter contre les fluctuations du marché. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux soutenir ses enfants orphelins.
texts.en: Mbekh is 55 years old and is a widow who has been active selling breakfasts and dinners for the past year. She took advantage of an opportunity when a new bakery in the town opened; she set herself up nearby and developed her business there. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since April 205 and has already had seven loans from the institution. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy and install a stock of groceries in order to make a more interesting profit margin. At the same time she wants to be able to contend with fluctuations in the market. The increase in her profits will allow her to support her fatherless children more easily.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 40 years old, married to Jedida, and they have 4 children. He has been in carpentry for the last 16 years and earns a monthly profit of 28,000 KES.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of registered KADET LTD clients. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to buy wood and carpentry materials. With the anticipated profits, Martin will save and pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, he hopes to grow his business, and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy wood and carpentry materials

loans.name: Ahos-Si Group

texts.fr: AHOS-SI est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Agnès. Les membres du groupe sont des cohabitants. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Agnès est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Agnès est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Olivier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agnès n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Agnès mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d'année,la vente de produits cosmétiques et des médicaments. Agnès s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Agnès et aux autres membres du groupe AHOS-SI, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
AHOS-SI is a group with three members.  The group's representative (who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Agnès.  The members of this group live together.  With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.  Agnès is 37 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to a welder named Olivier.  The couple have four children who all attend school and are in their care.  Agnès herself never went to school.

In order to cover her own needs as well as those of her children, Agnès has been selling cosmetics and medicines for 15 years.  She stocks up in the markets in Benin.  This business makes her the income she needs to help cover her family expenses.  This first loan will allow Agnès and the other members of the AHOS-SI group to grow their businesses, their customer numbers and their income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and medicines

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 60 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he uses his lorry for a transport business.  He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. He has managed to improve his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. His desire is to venture into other businesses in five years.

He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to service his lorry.

loans.use: To service his lorry

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está casado,  del matrimonio tiene un hijo menor que aun se encuentra en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la fabricación de pasacalles y carteles en la cuidad de Villa Elisa, se inicio en este rubro en una empresa que se dedicaba a lo mismo y luego de varios años de servicio en la misma aprendió el oficio y con un poco de capital el cual había ahorrado se independizo y logro abrir su negocio.
Comenta que le va muy bien, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas, chapas de aluminio, lo cual son materiales esenciales para su trabajo. De antemano agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da. Más adelante desea ampliar su negocio y dar fuente de trabajo a las personas de su cuidad.
texts.en: Julio is from the city of San Lorenzo.  He is married, and from this marriage he has a young child who is still in school.  He dedicates himself to making banners and posters in the city of Villa Elisa.  He got into this line of business after working at a business that did the same thing and, after several years there, he learned the trade and used a little money he had saved to go off on his own and open a business.  He comments that things are going very well, which is why he would like to continue with his work.  This is the reason he is requesting a loan, in order to buy paints and aluminum plates, which are essential materials for his work.  He thanks the foundation ahead of time for providing him with this opportunity.  In the future, he would like to expand his business and provide a source of jobs for the people of his city.

loans.use: buy paints and aluminum plating.

loans.name: Rossi-Let Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "ROSSI-LET" est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent de part leur activité. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Lucrèce Ablavi est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Lucrèce Ablavi est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucrèce Ablavi est une veuve qui a quatre enfants, dont un reste encore à sa charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Lucrèce Ablavi a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et à celui de son enfant encore à sa charge, Lucrèce Ablavi mène comme activité la vente des jouets. Lucrèce Ablavi exerce cette activité depuis douze ans. Lucrèce Ablavi s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité surtout à l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Lucrèce Ablavi et les autres membres du groupe "ROSSI-LET" sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group "ROSSI-LET" is composed of three persons who know one another through their work. The representative of this group, by the name of Lucrèce Ablavi, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. With the goal of boosting their business, so as to cope better with the demands of their customers, this group is requesting financial support for the first time from ALIDé. 

Lucrèce Ablaviis 54 years old and lives in Benin. She is a widow who has four children. One of the children is still in her care; some are in school. Lucrèce Ablavi has attended middle school. To meet her various needs and those of her child, she has a business selling toys. She has been in this business for twelve years. Her supplies are from one of the markets of Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business, especially as the year-end holiday's approach, as well as satisfying their customers, Lucrèce Ablaviand the other members of the group "ROSSI-LET" are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to grow their business.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and married with 7 children, 5 of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a departmental house as a bar for her business extension in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a focused businessman aged 34 and he is single. For the last two years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. His potential customers are passersby.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy motorbike spare parts. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: buy motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Kirua Group

texts.en:
Edward, who is in his early 30's, is married with one child who still goes to school. Edward has been a taxi driver for 5 years now. He works from 7 a.m to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Edward used the previous loans to open a business for his wife selling clothes, bought land, paid school fees and household expenses. Edward used to drive someone's taxi, but now he has bought his own taxi. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants the current loan to make bricks for building his house. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kirua", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to make bricks for building his house

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a single man aged 22. For the last four years, he has been selling boiled eggs to make a living.  His potential customers are passersby.  In the next 5 years, he wants to establish his business into wholesale.  Jeremiah dreams of practicing poultry farming in the future. Through his previous loans from Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.  Jeremiah has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy trays of eggs.

loans.use: buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es: El señor Gabino es chofer de transporte libre y su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida. Con el dinero del crédito comprará aros para las llantas de su vehiculo, pues necesita hacer este cambio inmediatamente.  Con los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad de transporte y los ingresos de la esposa por venta de comida cubren los gastos de la familia. Vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la zona German Busch en la ciudad de El Alto. Gabino es casado y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que la cliente obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Gabino is an independent taxi driver, and his wife sells food.

He will use the money from the loan to buy hubcaps for his vehicle’s tires.  He needs to make this change immediately.

The income from his transportation business and the income from his wife selling food cover the family’s expenses.

He lives in a rented house in the German Busch area of the city of El Alto.  Gabino is married and has one child.  This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy hubcaps for his vehicle’s tires.

loans.name: Danish

texts.en:
Danish is married and blessed with two children.  He has been selling onions for the last six years to make a living.  Danish has employed three people to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to become the supplier of onions in his region.  

Danish is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy onions for resale. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy onions to resell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es albañil y su esposa se dedica a la cría de ganado y venta de leche. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de compra de un terreno que está cerca de donde vive y donde pastarán las vacas que tiene para producción de leche. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Villandrani, es casado y tiene dos hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el anterior crédito que obtuvo pues  le ayudó a mejorar los ingresos. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito pasa a través de los financiadotes en Kiva.
texts.en:
Juan is a bricklayer, and his wife raises livestock and sells milk.

The money from the loan will cover the cost of buying a piece of land that is close to where he lives.  It will be the place where their milk cows graze.

He lives in his parents’ house in Villandrani.  He is married and has two children.

He is very happy with the previous loan that he had; it helped him improve his income.

This is his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy land for his milk cows to graze.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is 30 years old and married with 8 children, none of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Monika requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to able her to purchase more charcoal for sale. She says that with the extra income from this loan she is planning to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro is a married man. He has 4 children with two currently enrolled in school. His wife works as a homemaker and does farming on the side. Nassoro operates a medicinal supplies business and sells his goods from home. He's worked in this business for 10 years and was previously employed as a religion teacher. His primary customers are neighbors and the surrounding community. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His other source of income includes construction activities. He describes his greatest business challenge to be customers' low purchasing power. His largest monthly expense is the water bill. 

Nassoro will use the Kes 30,000 loan to expand the business and purchase additional medicines. He aspires to open his own medicine shop in the future. He joined Yehu because they're clear and open about the provided services.

loans.use: To expand the business and purchase additional medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients like noodles, rice, potatoes, and chuño (tuber), for the boarding house food service that his wife manages.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman. She has three children with two currently enrolled in school. Aisha operates a poultry business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for six months and her primary customers are wholesalers in town. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Aisha's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the dropping prices for chickens. Her largest monthly expense is food for her family.

Aisha will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more chickens. Aisha aspires to expand into her own wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORVENIR” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: calzado de bebe, venta de helados de canela, confección de colchones, venta de condimentos, venta de muebles y carpintería, venta de tenis, venta de pollos, venta de comida. 

La señora Juana  indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de su amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calcetines que trabaja recientemente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de calcetines), que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializa en el puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con el grupo la capacitación de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The Porvenir communal association will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Juan Pablo.  There are eight members and it is run by a board headed by Juana.  The businesses that the association members carry out are varied, including baby shoes, selling cinnamon ice cream, making mattresses, selling condiments, selling furniture and woodworking, selling sneakers, selling chicken, and selling food.

Juana indicates that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of her friend.  Currently she has a business selling socks that she is working on recently.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her merchandise (buying socks), which she will acquire from the markets and later sell in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family in every way possible, since she is married and has two children.

When you ask Juana what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes to share the health and credit training with the group.

loans.use: to buy socks.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin es productor lechero  también vende afrecho.  Con el dinero del crédito adquirirá ganado lechero, un par de vacas lecheras para aumentar la producción de leche y sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja  en la provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz; es soltero  y  no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva. Es cliente Impro desde el año 2010.
texts.en: Edwin is a dairy farmer; he also sells bran.  He will use the money from the loan to buy dairy cattle: a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and his income.  He lives in a house of his own located in Laja, Los Andes Province in La Paz Department.  He’s single and has no children.  This is the first time his loan will be channeled through Kiva.  He has been an Impro client since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Nyamawi is a married man and has five children, four of whom are currently enrolled in school. Nyamawi has operated a carpentry business for 15 years. His primary customers are neighbors and town people. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Nyamawi's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be difficult access to materials and his largest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Nyamawi will use the 35,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to purchase building supplies and wood materials. Nyamawi aspires to expand the business and purchase working equipment in the future. He joined Yehu because of their low interest rates and shortest loan processing time.

loans.use: To purchase building supplies and wood materials.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer 2 Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a la señora Deidamia, ella organizó a sus amigas y vecinas D. ciudad del Este, y ellas quedaron muy contentas y animadas con la idea y D. allí surge el grupo llamado Nuevo Amanecer, integrado actualmente por 18 mujeres, cursando el segundo ciclo del programa. Ellas cuales trabajan dentro D. un ambiente D. cooperación y apoyo.
La señora Deidamia una persona muy trabajadora y activa, se dedica a la venta D. todo tipo D. prendas, con lo cual pueD. mantener a sus familiares. Comenta que tiene buena clientela, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos para paliar los gastos que tiene, como así también para poder seguir con su pequeña microempresa. Dice que le gustaría seguir con lo que hace, por lo que solicita el crédito, el cual invertirá en la compras D. prendas para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Deidamia who organized her friends and neighbors from Ciudad del Este.  They were very happy and excited by the idea and the 'Nuevo Amanecer' (New Dawn) group was born.  The group is currently maD. up of 18 women and they are in their second loan cycle within the program.  They work in an environment of cooperation and support.

Deidamia is a very hard-working and active person who sells all kinds of clothes.  This enables her to support her family members.  She tells us that she has good customers which makes her good income to cover her expenses and continue running her small micro-business.  She says that she would like to continue doing what she is doing and is requesting this loan to invest in buying clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to re-sell

loans.name: Derick

texts.en: Derick is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last nine years, he has been taking photographs to make a living. Previously, he was baking cakes. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy frames, films and batteries.

loans.use: To buy frames, films and batteries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, shredded pork, gas and oil

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel es productor lechero y además es promotor veterinario, su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero del crédito comprará un par de vacas lecheras para mejorar su producción de leche y sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz; es casado y tiene cuatro  hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita un crédito;  el análisis financiero indica que es sujeto de crédito y el análisis social indica que merece una tasa preferencial de interés, por lo que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Daniel is a dairy farmer and also a veterinary salesman.  His wife helps him with the farming chores.  With the money from the loan he will buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and his income.  He lives in a house of his own located in Achacachi, La Paz Department.  He’s married and has four children.  This is the first time the client has requested a loan.  The financial analysis indicates that he’s credit worthy and the social analysis indicates that he deserves a preferential interest rate so it will be channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Thoya

texts.en:
Thoya is a married man with two children. He’s operated a barbershop for over 10 years. His primary customers are neighbors and townspeople. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Thoya’s other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be fewer customers during the rainy season and his largest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Thoya will use the 35,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to purchase scissors, gel, and other supplies. Thoya aspires to grow his business and purchase additional supplies in the future. He joined Yehu because of low interest rates and shortest loan processing time.

loans.use: To purchase scissors, gel, and other supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking business man aged 42. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. He supplies construction materials such as cement and sand. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stones and cement.

loans.use: buy stones and cement

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase stock of fruits, vegetables, and charcoal.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es artesano en cerrajería y su esposa es tejedora. Con el dinero del crédito adquirirá material de trabajo como fierros y metales para elaborar productos artesanales que vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita un crédito. Sus deseos de mantener su negocio y proveer a su familia son encomiables y por  esta razón es que su solicitud es enviada a los financiadotes de Kiva.
texts.en: Juan is a metal craftsman and his wife’s a weaver.  With the money from the loan he will acquire work supplies like iron and metals to make the crafts he sells in various markets in the city of El Alto.  He lives in a rented house in the Ballivián sector of the city of El Alto; he’s married and has a son.  This is the first time the client has requested a loan.  His desire to maintain his business and provide for his family is commendable and this is why his request is sent on to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy iron and metals for his metal crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy churros, cookies, rice, beans, soda and sweet treats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy paints and bolts

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother with one child. She operates a poultry business and grocery stand. She's worked in this business for over 10 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and townspeople. Christine rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be limited availability of chickens and her largest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Christine will use this 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to purchase chickens and groceries. Christine aspires to expand into her own wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their transparency.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and groceries.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria, por la necesidad de mejorar en el negocio, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, el cual utilizara en la compra de una plancha para hacer pupusas, y compra de materiales de cocina, como aceite, condimentos, azúcar, para tener en la preparación de la venta.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo, pudo realizar la compra y mejorar en el negocio, su familia por el momento se encuentra bien y con deseos de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Gloria needs to improve her business and so decided to take out a new loan which she will use to buy a hotplate for making pupusas, and cooking supplies such as oil, seasonings and sugar, so that she can prepare her food for sale.

Gloria's previous loan helped her as she was able to make her purchase and improve her business.  Her family are currently well and she is keen to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a hotplate for making pupusas, oil, seasonings and sugar

loans.name: Franciso

texts.es: El señor Francisco es productor lechero y trabaja con la ayuda de toda su familia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar su producción de leche, pues la demanda es muy buena. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la localidad de Villandrani en el departamento de La Paz;  es casado y tiene cinco hijos pero dos ya están casados. Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita un crédito y su análisis social y financiero indican que necesita el crédito y que puede pagarlo sin ningún problema.
texts.en: Francisco is a dairy farmer and his entire family helps him with the work.  He needs the loan to buy a dairy cow of a better breed to increase milk production because demand is very good.  He lives in a house of his own located in Villandrani in La Paz Department.  He’s married and has five children who are all now married.  This is the first time the client has requested a loan and the financial and social analyses indicate that he needs the loan and is able to repay it problem-free.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Celia; La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 8,3 años de edad, la socia trabaja con comercio minorista, la socia cría animales menores, ella tiene pollos y también compra para incrementar su negocio, la socia también tiene su puesto de venta de salchipapas y en esta ocasión requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de pollos y papas al por mayor para incrementar su negocio; la socia con este ingreso económico puede pagar el colegio de sus menores hijos, la alimentación de ellos y esto le permite crecer y mejorar sus calidad de vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos al por mayor como 20 y de papas por arrobas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the communal bank "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas."  This communal bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district of the province and department of Cusco.

Celia is 34 years old.  She lives with a partner and has 2 children aged 8 and 3.  She works as a retail merchant, and also raises small animals.  She has chickens, and also buys them to expand her business.  She has a post where she sells "salchipapas" (sausages with french fries).  At this time, she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of chicken and potatoes at wholesale to expand her business.  With the income from her business, she can pay for school and feed her young children, which will allow them to grow and improve their quality of life.  She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of 20 chickens at wholesale, and sacks of potatoes.

She is grateful for this loan, and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy 20 chickens at wholesale and sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking business man aged 60. He is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school.  He has been repairing vehicles for the last fifteen years to support his family. He has employed four people in his business.  

Joseph has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is widow with three children, of whom two are currently enrolled in school. Mupa operates a juicer and grocery business from her home. She's worked in this business for over 10 years and her primary customers are neighbors and townspeople. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mupa's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be availability of chickens and her largest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mupa will use this 20,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to purchase groceries and other inventory. Mupa aspires to expand her business operations in the future. She joined Yehu because they practice openness.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other inventory.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa Estela; La socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 de ellos ya son independientes y solo vive  y apoya en los estudios a uno de los hijos de 28 años de edad, la socia trabaja  en artesanía en la plaza principal de Andahuaylillas, la socia vende especialmente textiles que ella misma los fabrica y otros que los compra hechos, la socia tiene un stand ambulatorio con su comité de artesanas en la misma plaza del pueblo y aprovechan la vista de los muchos turistas que viene a ver la copia de la capilla Sixtina en América, es una capilla muy peculiar y bellísima, a esto se suma la belleza innata del poblado con sus callecitas serpentiantes y empedradas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas para los textiles , ella comprara lana de alpaca, y textiles ya hechos para incrementar sus ventas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa Estela belongs to the communal bank "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas." This communal bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district of the province and department of Cusco.

Rosa Estela is 49 years old. She lives with a partner and has 5 children, 4 of whom are already independent.  Only one of her children still lives with her; he is 28, and she supports him with his education. Rosa has a handicraft business in the main plaza of Andahuaylillas.  She specializes in selling textiles that she makes herself, and others that she buys ready-made.  She has a sales post with a group of artisans in the plaza in her town, and she takes advantage of the fact that many tourists come there to see the "Copy of the Sistine chapel in America."  This is a very unusual and beautiful chapel, which is accentuated by the innate beauty of the town, with its serpentine cobbled streets.  Rosa requests a loan to invest in the purchase of wool for her textiles.  She will buy alpaca wool, and ready-made textiles to increase her sales.

Rosa is grateful for this loan, and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool and textiles to increase her sales

loans.name: Reina Melany

texts.es:
Reina, quiere seguir incrementando el negocio, por eso está nuevamente solicitando préstamo, para la compra de insumos de cocina como: pollo, carnes, tomates, papas, condimentos, aceite, maíz, que los utiliza a diario en sus ventas.
El préstamo anterior le sirvió para comprar materiales para el negocio, la inversión fue exitosa y de las ventas pudo pagarlo, su negocio está mejorando y todo gracias a los aportes de los prestamos y la compra de buenos productos.
texts.en:
Reina would like to continue increasing her business and so she is once again requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies such as chicken, meat, tomatoes, potatoes, seasonings, oil and corn which she uses every day to make the food she sells.

Reina's previous loan helped her to buy supplies for her business.  The investment was successful and, through her sales, she was able to repay her loan.  Her business is improving thanks to the contributions of her loans and the fact that she buys good products.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, tomatoes, potatoes, seasonings and oil

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est une femme âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée à un employé d’une Société, et mère d’un enfant.  
Adjovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des cartes de recharge pour téléphone et du charbon de bois à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé, auprès des grossistes. Elle travaille seule. 
Adjovi a requis son premier  crédit de 300.000FCFA de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge et du charbon de bois. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjovi voudrait avoir une grande boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjovi is a 25-year-old woman. She is married to a company worker and has one child.
Ajovia has worked as a retailer since 2007. She buys and re-sells rechargeable phone cards and charcoal at her home to all customers. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Lomé. She works by herself.
Adjovi is seeking her first loan of 300,000 FCFA from WAGES in order to buy rechargeable phone cards and charcoal.
In the coming years, Adjovi would like to have a large store. She says that with her profits, she foresees contributing to providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey is married and blessed with two children.  He has been operating a motorbike transport business for the last one year to support his family.  He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. He has employed two people to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. With 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.use: buy motorbike spare parts
